Los pocos objetos a la venta en el mercado parecen costar mucho más de los que los lugareños pueden pagar. La gente está malnutrida, sus animales enfermos o moribundos, y sus herramientas de trabajo rotas. En los callejones sólo abundan las moscas y los perros.

Oyes quejas en el mercado sobre el precio de los productos básicos, y las tiendas están medio vacías. Ves síntomas de malnutrición en la gente y en los animales, y tanto las herramientas como los edificios necesitan reparaciones. Muchos han emigrado buscando trabajo en otra parte.

De vez en cuando oyes quejas en el mercado sobre el precio de los productos básicos, pero parece haber una cantidad razonable de bienes a la venta. Hay algunos edificios abandonados, así como tiendas y carros, pero nada fuera de lo normal.
La gente parece bien alimentada y bastante satisfecha. Los artesanos hacen mucho negocio, y parecen estar llegando algunos emigrantes de otras regiones en busca de fortuna.

Los muros, calles y casas se encuentran en buen estado. Los mercados están rebosantes de emigrantes de regiones cercanas, atraídos por la disponibilidad tanto de bienes como de trabajo. El repiqueteo de martillos y telares habla por sí solo de la actividad de los talleres artesanales.

Sólo hay un puñado de gente lo suficientemente fuerte para trabajar los campos, y muchos se están llenando de malas hierbas. El resto de lugareños están débiles y malnutridos, o se han ido ya a otros lugares. Los animales domésticos hace tiempo que murieron de hambre o fueron devorados, aunque aún quedan algunos cadáveres por los alrededores, con los huesos roídos por animales salvajes.

Hay algunos granjeros y animales en los campos, pero su escaso número sugiere que más de un lugareño está emigrando en busca de comida. Los aperos de granja están roñosos y rotos. Las zarzas y malas hierbas empiezan a invadir algunos campos a las afueras.

Los campos y huertos están llenos de aldeanos dedicados a las labores agrícolas. Tanto hombres como animales parecen bastante sanos y bien alimentados. No obstante, hay algunos huertos sin sembrar a las afueras, y algunos muros necesitan reparaciones, lo cual indica que no hay suficientes manos para todo el trabajo pendiente de realizar.
Los campos y huertos bullen de actividad, sacos llenos de grano y ristras de carne seca atestiguan la productividad de las granjas y pastos de la aldea.

Los campos y huertos bullen de actividad, las zanjas de riego recién excavadas indican que los granjeros disponen de suficiente tiempo libre y energías para expandir las áreas de cultivo. Los jornaleros parecen estar llegando en masa para ayudar con el trabajo y beneficiarse de la prosperidad general.

Los palmerales están prácticamente abandonados, y los canales que los irrigan están obstruidos por el lodo. El puñado de aldeanos que se ve está malnutrido e inquieto. Los animales domésticos hace tiempo que murieron de hambre o fueron devorados, aunque aún quedan algunos cadáveres en las afueras, con sus huesos roídos por los chacales del desierto.

Se ven pocos lugareños cuidando los palmerales, y en algunos rincones el desierto parece estar invadiendo los huertos. Muchos de los canales están obstruidos por el lodo, y los pozos y cisternas están llenos de arena.

Hombres y mujeres están atareados cuidando de los palmerales, trepando a sus copas para recolectar la fruta. Hay animales con aspecto saludable accionando las bombas y poleas que llevan agua a los campos. Algunos de los canales de irrigación, sin embargo, necesitan arreglos.

Los palmerales y los huertos bullen de actividad. Los granjeros se hablan animadamente unos a otros desde las copas de los árboles, donde recogen los dátiles. Los chirridos de las bombas de madera, los bramidos de animales domésticos y el fragor del agua hablan por sí solos de un sistema de irrigación que florece gracias a la atención de los lugareños.

Los palmerales bullen de actividad, y los granjeros acarrean una extraordinaria cosecha de dátiles para vender en el mercado. Hombres y mujeres trabajan duro excavando nuevos pozos y canales para poder irrigar aún más tierras.

Intentáis persuadir a {s50}, pero parece que vuestros argumentos no le convencen. Cada vez que decís algo con sentido, parece que lo bordáis con algo incorrecto que os obliga a volver a comenzar. Al terminar, no habéis podido decir nada medianamente coherente en vuestro favor y os dais cuenta que lo único que habéis hecho es meteros en un pozo. {s50} no se ha quedado con una impresión favorable.

Intentáis persuadir a {s50}, pero {reg51?ella:él} os domina desde el comienzo. Incluso vuestros mejores argumentos suenan a hueco. {s50}, por su parte, no cree que lo que habéis dicho tenga demasiado sentido.

{s50} resulta ser inteligente y convincente y parece que sois incapaz de presentarle un argumento que {reg51?ella:él} no sea capaz de contrarrestar con racionalidad. Al final, ninguno de los dos conseguís ganar terreno en la discusión.

Gracias a vuestra lucidez mental y buenos argumentos sois capaz de exponer vuestro caso, forzando a {s50} a concederos la razón varias veces. Sin embargo, {reg51?ella:él} aún mantiene dudas sobre vuestras peticiones.

Vuestro apasionante discurso resuena en los oídos de los oyentes como si fuera poesía. Parece que el mundo entero guardara silencio para poder escucharos mejor. Vuestras palabras han emocionado profundamente a {s50} y {reg51?ella:él} parece mucho más proclive a ayudaros.

Os han concedido el derecho de portar un estandarte. Vuestro estandarte representa vuestro rango y os proporciona honor. ¿Qué estandarte elegiréis?

Os dais cuenta demasiado tarde de que vuestro dinero no durará mucho más. Habéis dilapidado rápidamente lo poco que conseguisteis ahorrar y fracasáis en vuestros desesperados intentos de volver a la aventura. Vuestros días terminan en {s9}, mendigando por las calles y viviendo de la benevolencia de la iglesia.

Os dais cuenta demasiado tarde de que vuestro dinero no durará mucho más. Habéis dilapidado rápidamente lo poco que conseguisteis ahorrar. Una vez que el último denar se ha evaporado en vuestras manos, no tenéis más remedio que salir a robar por los callejones de {s9}, utilizando vuestras habilidades para ganaros el sustento robando calderilla de las mujeres y ciudadanos pobres.

Os dais cuenta demasiado tarde de que vuestro dinero no durará mucho más. Habéis dilapidado rápidamente lo poco que conseguisteis ahorrar y acabáis vagabundeando y sin blanca, yendo de taberna en taberna y mendigando tragos a clientes indulgentes a cambio de regalarles con relatos sobre la guerra, que nadie se cree.

El dinero que habéis ahorrado no os dura mucho tiempo, pero sois capaz de reunir lo suficiente como para asentaros cerca de la aldea de {s7}. Allí montáis vuestra propia granja y pronto comienzan a aparecer potenciales {esposas/esposos}. Con el tiempo, los campesinos comienzan a trataros como {un héroe/una heroína} local. Siempre os ceden un lugar de honor en las fiestas y vuestras hazañas son narradas una y otra vez en las tabernas, para que los niños conserven para siempre vuestro recuerdo.

El dinero que habéis ahorrado no os dura mucho tiempo, pero es suficiente para comprar una pequeña taberna en {s9}. Aunque al principio los lugareños desconfían de vos, pronto os aceptan entre los suyos. Con el tiempo, vuestra taberna se convierte en un popular centro de diversión y reuniones. La gente llega desde lugares remotos para comer o alojarse, debido a vuestra fama y a las historias épicas que contáis de vuestros días como {aventurero/aventurera}.

Habéis sabido ahorrar a lo largo de vuestra carrera y ahora vuestro dinero e inteligencia os permiten hacer varias excelentes inversiones para asegurar vuestro futuro. Tras comprar varias tiendas y almacenes en {s9}, vuestra sagacidad os convierte en {uno/una} de las mercaderes más prominentes de la ciudad y pronto se os conoce tanto por vuestro imperio comercial como por vuestras hazañas en batalla.

Al ser noble con tierras, aunque menor, vuestro futuro está asegurado. Os asentáis en vuestras posesiones de {s7}, administrando la aldea y sus campos, impartiendo justicia en las cortes locales y cumpliendo vuestras obligaciones para con vuestro señor feudal. Ocasionalmente, vuestro señor os llama para que dirijáis sus campañas, pero se trata de periodos cortos y nunca volvéis realmente a las aventuras de vuestros días jóvenes. Ya habéis hecho vuestra fortuna. Con las propiedades que tenéis, hay pocos caprichos que vuestros ingresos no os puedan permitir.

No hay duda de que habéis tenido gran éxito en la vida. Vuestras enormes propiedades y la fortuna acumulada durante vuestros días de aventura son suficientes como para garantizaros una vida fácil durante el resto de vuestros días. Al retiraros a vuestro noble asiento en {s8} cambiáis la aventura por la política, y pronto os establecéis como un gran poder dentro del reino de vuestro señor feudal. Entreteniéndoos con las intrigas, vuestros propios bosques para cazar, un gran salón para celebraciones y un ciento de épicas historias de guerra que contar, vuestros siguientes años pasan sin más preocupaciones.

Como recompensa por vuestro competente y noble servicio, vuestro señor feudal decreta que se os entregue un título hereditario, uniéndoos así a la nobleza mayor del reino. Pronto os encontráis como {Barón/Baronesa} de {s7}, convirtiéndoos en un cargo de confianza para vuestro señor feudal. Gracias a vuestro renombre, vuestra influencia y vuestro poder político encubierto crecen. Ahora pasáis vuestros días jugando a juegos de poder, administrando vuestros grandes feudos y recordando los viejos tiempos de aventuras y gloria.

Aunque vuestros principios fueron humildes, vuestro señor feudal os tiene en gran estima y la sorpresa recorre el reino cuando os es concedido el título hereditario de {Conde/Condesa} de {s9}. Vastos feudos y fortunas son ahora vuestros. Pronto os convertís en {el consejero/la consejera} más importante de vuestro señor feudal, casi su igual, y responsable de gran parte de la administración de su reino, mientras os sentáis en el trono de vuestro propio palacio como una de las figuras más poderosas del Nuevo Mundo.

Sí que lo soy. Lidero una compañía de valientes soldados.
Es cierto que la guerra está en mi naturaleza. ¿Sabéis algo de mi oficio, por casualidad?
Nunca había oído a un orco llamarme {reg33?madam:sir}.
Un asesino eficiente nunca viene mal.
El camino importa poco. Vos parece que habéis recorrido muchos kilómetros en vuestra vida.
No gracias, no compro pociones mágicas a desconocidos.
Gracias... ¡eh, espera! ¡Dónde está mi bolsa de monedas?
Gracias, me sentaré. ¿Vos no sois un caballero?
Necesito mirar si quiero contratar a los mejores guerreros para mi compañía.
¿Quién sois y qué hacéis en esta ciudad?
¿Perdón?
Parecéis un hombre afligido. ¿Cuál es vuestra historia?
Puede que sí. ¿Cuáles son vuestras habilidades?
Sí que lo soy. ¿Qué asuntos queréis tratar?
Sólo charlar. ¿Cuál es vuestra historia?
¿Sois bastante cascarrabias, no?

¿En qué puedo ayudaros?

Tengo algo de tiempo libre, así que... ¿por qué no?
Lo siento. ¿Nos conocemos?
Son mis fieles guerreros. ¿Qué pasa con ellos?
¿Cómo va a encontrar trabajo un mercenario con esa actitud?
Estoy buscando brazos fuertes para mi ejército, no problemas.
Curioso. Tenéis aspecto de rey funerario, pero no acento de Nehekara.

I am not one to be taken in by fanciful tales.
Thanks I guess.
I will not drink with anyone who slights the honourable.
I am not staring, just passing by.

You insult my ears with that high pitch wailing of yours.
No, I need no help from you.

I don't have time I am afraid.

Madness really is the strangest of afflictions.

No way grandpa, you stink!

I have no business with you ogre.

I have no business with the undead.

You don't look like much of an adventurer.... mmmm.
Your party interests me.
I enquired when I saw your party enter the town. They say you are a bold warrior and that you are on the lookout for other able warriors to join you.
Yes it seems my lack of orcness never escapes me.
Then Ripnitch the assassin is where you should invest your money.
I have trodden every part of these great lands, I am Mathias Thulmann, Master Witch Hunter.
I am not offering a potion, I am offering my services on the field of battle and also recommending my men.
Ah yes, you got me. I am not usually this rusty but I am feeling a bit peaky after eating all of Skeezles goats cheese, it has put me off my game.

I am a knight but I do not follow any soft, repressive codes such as chivalry and honour. All they do is trick a man into being obedient and to restrain all the natural and rightful urges a real man feels.
Grand campaigns usually mean lots of battles and lots of bloodshed which is exactly what I live for.
I don't see why but if you must know my name is Eketi and I am a Commander of the Dark Elf naval fleets.
Skrizzle, skrizzle................. wooooompa.............. Bug is me.................. woooooop.
My name is Sir Aristide, I am a knight from the court of King Leoncouer.
My name is Maephilin, I am a skilled horse archer and I used to patrol the lands of Ellyrion in the Old World looking for enemies so I am good at spotting enemies too.
I am looking for someone to travel with, to explore with and to share stories with and you look like just the kind of companion I am looking for.
I have no story really. I have been mocked and ridiculed my whole life. Skeezle is my name.
Well of course I am serious, it is a serious world out there with no room for trivialities.
Adventure, fun, the thrill of the chase, riding on the open sea in the face of danger that is what is important to me.
My name is Nakwatcha and I am completely lost.
I am just having a quick break from my treasure hunts, give myself a chance to splash the riches I manage to acquire.
I am sorry fellow, I thought you were another punter coming over to thank me for making my beloved brew.
I am about as dangerous as they come. Like my race I am on a path of destruction right now and no one will stand in my way.
I used to be a seafaring man you know, back when I used to leave port on a regular basis. Not enough booze out at sea know what I mean Captain, hahahaha. So you find me mostly on land now.
No, but I have tracked your party a number of times as you have travelled throughout the land. I am quite familiar with your movements.
They look like a decent lot but they could use some more training.
I am no mercenary and you are lucky I don't break you in two for saying so. Like most Ogres I used to be a mercenary when I was younger but I have moved on to greater things since then.
Two hours, I killed a guard at the gate for asking for a toll to pass. I have had no opportunity since then unfortunately.
That is because I am not a Nehekharan, I am an Imperial Lord or should I say I used to be an Imperial Lord anyway.

I am looking for a leader, someone who will give me fame and fortune.
I am looking for a leader, someone who will give me fame and fortune.
I am looking for a leader, someone who will give me fame and fortune.
I am looking for a leader, someone who will give me fame and fortune.
I am looking for a leader, someone who will give me fame and fortune.

Well know this, I am seeking a glorious death through fighting against the mightiest foes. It is my lifes mission but I will not go down easily, it will take a being of legends to send me to my grave. I used to be an engineer before I was disowned by my clan but this is my life now, I seek danger and maybe I will seek it with you.

My name is Felix. I am an adventurer and a poet and I wish to write the tales of the leaders I follow when I retire. I am currently bound to Gotrek but I lost him after a nights heavy drinking. I will go find him soon but in the meantime I would be happy to join your party.

My name is Jalil Najid and I used to be the personal bodyguard for many of my Kingdom's Caliphs. I am a master Janissary and I am famed for never letting an assassin get close enough to my master to get into hand to hand combat. My eyes are sharp and my skill with a bow is unrivalled, if I see you and you are an enemy, then you have but a few seconds to live.

My name is Oggy and I was kicked out of my tribe for my lack of aggression. I was never into breaking bones, just healing them. I am skilled in the arts of healing and medicine but these skills got me no respect back home.
I kill, get high on warpstone and kill some more. Just show me who is the enemy and my blade will see them rot on the soil.

I dedicate my life to the eradication of evil and the banishing of the unholy. I am currently taking a break from a major campaign against the Witch Elves that has been running for years. We drove them out of the Old World and now we have followed them to the New World.

My name is Captain Braganza, leader of the Braganza's Besiegers, masters of siege warfare and all wars of attrition. We are by far the best value mercenaries available in the Old World and up until recently we have been in the service of the great Borgio, the highest endorsement a company can get.

I am knowledgeable in all the plant life of these lands and their healing properties. Being a healer is all I have ever wanted to do but my family have sent me out into the world to teach me of the world's dangers and make me more serious apparently.
Goats cheese always does it to me but you know when you you love something so much, you don't even care, totally worth it, even if it has left me red handed.

Since I was born I have desired nothing but to kill and destroy for the Gods who favoured me with the power of transformation. So successful have I been that I have gained my own followers who fear nothing and will fight savagely to their last breath.

Our naval capacity in this part of the world has increased faster than any other race over the last few decades. Very soon only the pirates will be of real concern to us. We are currently building a new  and preparing plans for sea supremacy so I am out of work.
Grizznick, ratatatatatatatata.......................... I like to fight................. booomzoggyzoggy.

I have recently completed a great mission to make safe my people in our home lands. The King made me his greatest champion and gave me a time of leave to pray and to see my family but sooner than I expected I was called back.

Our situation here is not as secure as it used to be. We don't have much land and we are not as dominant on the sea. We are vulnerable in a way we have ever been. Sometimes the seas are too dangerous and we need to travel the whole distance of the land to get word to our brothers and sisters on the continent. This is why I am here.

My name is Abdul Khaliq and I am an an anthropologist and a historian. I live to be educated and to educate others on foreign cultures and of the culture of my great nation Araby. There is alot of misunderstanding and mistrust among races and nations in this world, a misinterpretation can lead to unfair opinions or even war. I hope to be a diplomat when I am older and bring greater understanding to the world.

For most of my life I was weak, beyond weak really but I always wanted to be an assassin and be respected by clan Eshin. I tried to better myself for years in the Old World, I never gave up despite knowing my ability but noone would really help me, and I was always a laughing stock.

You may enjoy a bit of the jovial but when you have lived a life of protecting and serving your people in times like we have had recently you will know why I am as stern as I am. My name is Scarloc and for much of my life I have protected the Laurelorn forest from invaders and trespassers, especially the green skinned kind.
My name is Eleanor Nash and I used to be captain of the Silver Twilight until she was burnt to cinders by the Tomb Kings.
I was chased out of the forest near my home by a family of giant snakes! We are normally used to them but these were so big and they chased me for 3 days.
I used to work for a dungeon adventurers guild but I was so damn unlucky. All kinds of stuff happened to me although I was always able to find a way to turn things around eventually.
The name is Joseph Bugman and I am the master brewer who brews 'Bugman's XXXXXX'. I am sure you know of my work. My brewery is near Karak Hirn although it has only recently been rebuilt.
Lustria is very attractive to the outside world. Many Human, Skaven, Orc and Elf try and steal the relics of our ancestors and the sacred treasures of Sotek.
You know you look like a leader, and I used to be on ships led by great leaders, great pirates who ruled the waves from one end to the other.

My name is Adelyn and I am skilled in the arts of tracking and path finding. My people are so hell bent on creating new machinery and technology to do their work for them but I prefer to use the more natural tools given to me.

My name is Erasmus. I used to be the head pitfighter trainer at the fighting pits in Mordheim. Some of the best fighters in history have been trained in my school. Strength, skill and relentlessness are all qualities I brand onto my students. Don't confuse them with the ones you see in tournaments, I have nothing to do with those incompetent fools.

My name is Uggluk Snaggletooth and I come from a land far to the north of the Chaos wastelands. I was once a mighty bull but now I am an outcast after losing a fight with the tyrant for control of my kingdom.
I was born to kill, ever since I was an infant I discovered the pleasures of smashing the life out of others. Any quest, any adventure, I will take it if it means a chance for a fight.

I liked to go exploring, treasure hunting to further the glory and prestige of the Empire. I wanted to discover new lands and hopefully claim uninhabited land for us on new continents. Sadly for me I went south instead of south west.

I hear rumours that you are that someone.

I hear rumours that you are that someone.
But know this, I give everything to the mission at hand, whatever the odds, and whatever the sacrifice! I will not tolerate a leader who does not do the same.

I am handy with a sword though not the best fighter you will ever see. Put me up against the skaven scum and you will see no warrior more determined than me. I can also rouse the camp with a tale or two I tell you.

I left my post recently though as the Caliphs are favouring Sultan's guards over us janissary's as bodyguards nowadays. I am looking for a new master to serve and I think you may be the one I am looking for.
I used to work as a medic in the Blood Bowl leagues but the crowd would rather chant insults at me for my softness rather than at the opposition team. So I left my job and was banished soon after.
You need one such as me yes?.

The difference here is that our intelligence on the Dark Elf land is not as reliable as before so we will now watch and wait rather than continue the assault. If you have a spot in your company for a skilled fighter I could ride with you in the mean time?

We are now released and my men have parted in order to train and make experience different types of wars. I now offer you my services, as their leader and the finest of our company. Hire me and also hire my troops whenever you can.
Anyway lets just call this even and get back to our business. I would offer you some cheese but it is all gone.
We are also for sale around the taverns of the Old World. If you can afford my men then hire them, that is if you want to win battles. I am available for hire too, the best of them all.

You will find them in the many taverns you will come across on your grand campaigns. They fight for the Gods and for me, if you will truly indulge me in relentless conquest then I may just fight for you.
It won't last forever though and when we are ready to make our move we will control the seas from top to bottom. Nothing will go on without our permission. On pain of death.
Gouge the eye, pluck the beast, gorge upon a greasy feast................. you like pie? Wahahahahahahahahah!

The King called for a crusade against Araby and the Tomb Kings, both have been gaining in power over the years and he fears that if one gets too powerful then they will invade. We are pre-empting this by striking first. The crusade has been on and off though as fighting there has been harder than we thought. We have made more enemies than we figured and our resources and campaign plans have had to be cancelled and rethought.

My passion is for breeding horses, I breed the best in the whole world and if my kin are to travel quickly here they will need my horses. I have set up 3 stables here which will breed the best stock quickly but I am reluctant to go home in case something goes wrong.
Obviously you will need more than my mind as you are a warrior party after all but I can assure you than I am a good horse archer who can do his fair share on the battlefield.

Then I came to this part of the world and Clan Rictus offered me friendship and training to become a stormvermin. My whole life I only wanted to be Eshin but it was Rictus who took me as their own. I know I am not that strong compared to most but for the first time in my life I can defend myself and be of service to those I wish to help.

Recently our lands have been infested with a dark power, Sylvanian we think although we thought they were destroyed. We have fled to a secret location while rangers such as myself stay on the lookout for a time when it is safe to come back.

I have been moving around from town to town but I am getting bored now of beating up all the men and taking their money at poker. It was fun at the start but now it is old hat. I want a challenge if you know what I mean, I didn't grow up to live the same low key life as these skallywags.
Right now I don't know what to do as I am young and not very experienced. I see safety in numbers so I would like to join your party and do what you do. I would feel a lot safer.

When I first heard about Lustria I was sceptical but when I was told about the riches to be found in the new world I nearly wet myself in excitement. My luck has turned since I started going there and I am not even sure if I will go back underground.

It was destroyed and all my workers killed a while ago by an army of Goblin raiders. I vowed vengeance and I took my war party out to get revenge for this gravest of crimes. We went out and spilt blood but only I returned. So much death, and not even the execution of justice can placate the fury inside of me. I cannot bear to go back to my brewery at the moment as the pain is still too near, my new workers are doing a fine job though and my brew is as good as ever. I will rise against the goblins again, my rangers are currently training in the town tournaments, what a force they will be.
Before it was small excursions, either private or state funded but now the humans are sending whole armies to our land and it poses the greatest threat to our existence.
Sometimes I wish I was back out there having adventures, but, hic, then I remember, hic hic. How comfortable it is in a tavern!

I have never been much of a fighter but I love to travel and see the world. There is always much war and conflict going on but if you take the time to learn local cultures and customs you can have a peaceful and fulfilling time as a traveller.
I am skilled in the arts of all weapons and I would like to join your company and help train your men into the finest fighters in the field.

Normally losing a fight with a tyrant costs you your life but I managed to escape, albeit in a much weaker state than I was. Now I stay in this part of the world, but one day once I have built up my strength and accumulated enough wealth to afford an army I will return and claim my kingdom for myself.
I saw your army earlier, if you are an adventurer then maybe you could use my strength, speed and agility to destroy your enemies?

I ended up in Nehekhara, in a Tomb King pyramid. I was excited with what I found but I was foolish and didn't heed the signs to run. I ran into a liche priest who cursed me and turned me in to one of them.

So I travelled around to find you and here you are.
So I travelled around to find you and here you are.
So I travelled around to find you and here you are.
So I travelled around to find you and here you are.
So I travelled around to find you and here you are.
You again! Either drink and talk, or drink and be silent, either way you'd better grab a tankard.

I have been selling poetry for which men can use to woo a fair maiden, it has been quite lucrative. You would have thought that people would be capable to at least think of something themselves, but I guess not.
I have been looking for work but not many people seem to see the value in a ranged specialist bodyguard. Maybe you are ready to give me work?
I have tried so hard but still no one wants to hire my talents. Have you found a good healer yet {sir/madame}, if not please do not forget I am here.
If you don't hire me soon my price will only go up.
My offer is still there if you wish to take it?
If you have sieges to win you know where I am.
Got any cheese?
You going to hire me or what?
Grrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr
You again, be quick.
Xom xom xom.
Good day to you again traveller, I trust everything is going your way.
If it isn't {playername} once more, you seem to travel nearly as fast as me. I am still looking for some real work, nothing but odd jobs have surfaced recently.
We meet again {playername}, I would still like to join your party so if you have room then please accept me as a companion.
If you need a stormvermin to help clear out your enemies then I am your rat.
Good day, let us have a drink and exchange information.
My new ship won't be built for a while yet, find me a quest you rascal.
Please help me, I don't know what to do.
How you been traveller? I hope you have been as successful as I have.
If you are going to fight any greens kins, no one will fight them harder than me, just tell me where they are.
There have been too many enemies to fight recently, our armies are spread thin.
Hic, hello again, hic.
I have been doing some more travelling and I am thinking of exploring the most hidden places in Lustria. If a better offer comes along though I would not say no.
I hope you change your mind soon about letting me in your party, your troops are still not up to scratch.
I have been moving around feeling a bit sorry for myself, I need to get back my old mentality.
I am a Norse barbarian, ready to take on anyone, any time, any place.
If you see Bastich let him know I am ready for that drinking contest. I used to be a lightweight but now drink just goes straight through me.

You will find all the beer and action you need with me Master Slayer
I can't believe I didn't find you sooner, welcome to my party
You are a specialist and I can use as many specialists in my party as I can find. Join me.
Well I could use your exceptional talents in my party.
I could use someone as ruthless as you.
You are welcome to join us Mathias, we could use some serious fire power.
I could use a man of your talents in my company
I should kill you where you stand for outrage.
I need confident companions in my army if I am to achieve all I aim to achieve. Your love of riches will be well taken care of as well.
I could use your strength, if you will fight for me?
I do quite a bit of travelling by sea, I could use you in my party.
You're a bit nuts but if you like fighting you can fight for me?
While you are not on the front line, I could use you in my army if you are available?
Speed and accuracy are welcome in my party.
Just so long as you are useful on the battlefield I am happy to hire you.
You sound like you have great resolve and if you are available you can come into my service?
I run an adventure company and I will be travelling around the entire world so if you care to join us you will get the information you need.
If it is adventure you seek then you may be keen to know that I lead an adventure party.
I am feeling generous so I will allow you to join my party.
You know you can be even more successful if you fight for me, I plan to leave no stone of this world unturned.
Maybe you can release your fury fighting for me, maybe it will help you get back to your old self.
There will always be threats to any nation, what brings you to this tavern?
Well if there is still some drive in you I could lead you on one last adventure.
Well instead of following us when you see us why don't you join us?
I could use a good trainer in my crew.
I know you are not a mercenary, but if you join my company as a friend you will soon get back your strength as well as obtaining the wealth you speak of.
Your thirst for a fight will be quenched if you follow my leadership.
Sounds like you lost everything. I could use the skills of a Lord in my army, it could be a new start for you?

Maybe another day Felix the poet
I do not need a bodyguard I am afraid Jalil, but I wish you luck for the future.
A passive orc, I have seen it all now. So long.
My party requires a higher moral code than what you aspire to.
I can't risk you leaving at a bad time and ruining my plans.
I do not need your skills right now but I will remember you when I do.
Do you know who you just tried to steal from?
I feel your influence on my army would not be a positive one so I will continue my search for new companions.
I don't intend to always be at war. Maybe you would be better off raiding with bandits.
That sounds like a terrible state of affairs, I hope you fail.
Move aside you insane freak of nature.
Well when you invade another land this is what happens.
I am not sure you are right for my company.
You may have knowledge but I have no need for a horse archer.
Good for you Skeezle, I wish you all the best.
They probably left to get away from you Scarloc you monotonous bastard.
Yes well there is not alot I can do about that.
If it is safety you seek then believe me when I say that you would do well to avoid travelling with me.
Very impressive, just don't try to steal any of my treasure or you'll wish you never came here either.
A terrible tale, I am glad you got your revenge. Farewell.
If I remember rightly, Lustria invaded the Old World not too long ago. Don't dish what you can't take.
Thanks for the drink old man, farewell.
If I catch you following me again my troops will take you prisoner.
I can train my own men just fine.
Like me you have big plans Uggluk, but maybe you should learn from your defeat.
There is no space in my party for a man like you.
I heard that curiosity killed the cat, looks like with you it rose again.

That is settled then, we will drink brew and crack skulls together.
I am honoured to fight at your side {reg33?madame:sir}.
Excellent, you can count on me and you will find me relatively cheap when there are many half as good as me that go for twice the price.
I am always happy to be where I am valued.
Wisdom you have, and money also.
Excellent, if you are not already aware of my abilities I can assure you you will not be disappointed.
Then I am ready to join you and don't fail to use my knowledge when planning a siege, the faster a siege is won the less chance of a relieving army interfering.
You could try but I will escape your grasp, I am faster than you think, peaky or not. If you are smart you would hire me instead of attack me, make the most of my talents.
Good. Put me in a unit with some of my Venators and you will see a green field turn red.
I could fight for you if I knew you were serious and not just looking to use me for one important mission and then settle down like others have done. If you do I will kill you as I killed them.
I am used to only serving the mighty rulers of Naggaroth but I suppose I could join you to pass the time.
Mish mash Brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrgash, Bug will fight again.

When I am on extended times of rest the Lady often comes to me in visions and instructs me on what we should do. It has been so long now I am worried she will not come, maybe I enter the field of battle once more and show her I am still worthy.
I would be pleased to ride with you.
I am very grateful for this opportunity. I have great knowledge on all races and cultures so if you wish to find a diplmatic solution rather than the sword then I will be happy to advise.
I joined an adventure party before and I wasn't much use on the battlefield. I promise it will be different this time.
I am not used to travelling in large groups of strangers but if you travel as much as you say then it would be a good idea for me to join you.
Really! Well you'd better know how to show a girl a good time or I won't be hanging around.
Oh  thank you, thank you. I have met some really nasty characters since I got lost I am afraid to travel out on my own.
I can handle things myself, I can fight alone or as part of a team. I have missed some companionship I must admit.
If you promise me we will fight some Goblins I will follow you where ever you go.
Revered Old Blood took control of my unit to use as his bodyguards and he didn't give me a new assignment.
It will take me a while to get back to my old form but why not?
You do seem to travel a lot for an adventuring party which is good for me.
You will see the difference in your men in no time.
Well I suppose I need to start somewhere on the road to regaining my prime.
Then I will join you, just keeps the battles coming and I will stay with you.
Lost everything I did. I was nearly killed when I returned to the Empire and you can be sure I want nothing to do with the Tomb Kings. I am stuck but you are offering me a way out.

I will join you if you are the one to give me what I seek.
I will join you if you are the one to give me what I seek.
I will join you if you are the one to give me what I seek.
I will join you if you are the one to give me what I seek.
I will join you if you are the one to give me what I seek.
Just don't let me down or I will squash you like a greenskin.
Just don't forget to stop off in the odd tavern or two on our journeys.
I am great in a siege too, just give me a view to the ladder and half the invaders will fall I swear it.
My healing hands are your healing hands.
My blade will shriek to your bidding.
I live to eradicate evil, to vanquish all my foes with pistol and with sabre. Now your enemies are my enemies, if only for a while.
While I worked for Borgio I never lost siege, they all starved, fell or surrendered. I hope to maintain the same record with you.
I am an excellent thief and finder of treasure and I know the halfling herblore so I can perform some basic healing as well.
I enjoy war so try not to bore me by having extended periods of peace. You may pay me but I still expect to have a good time.
They say that money is the way to tell how serious most employers are so I will require a sum which signals your intentions.

I will need to keep my combat skills in practice for when I am called back so an agreement between us would be mutually beneficial. I will warn you now that when I am called for I will leave immediately.
Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaagh!.

I can't go back to the King without good news, I wouldn't dream of failing him so fighting for you could be the answer to my situation. I just hope you are an honourable leader, I will not serve a tyrant.
No enemies will slip past me.
If you ever decide to start up your own kingdom, I would also make an excellent advisor although I will have to prove that to you with time.
My polearm training means I can inflict terrible damage on the enemy, even those great horses they ride.
I am the best you will find with a bow, I cannot stress that enough. You don't need to worry about me on the battlefield.
Don't think that because I am a girl you can take advantage of me. I know all the tricks and more. And if you ask me even once to make you some salmagundi I will cut your balls off.

Amazonian sisters are notorious for being tough but I am not. I regret not training with the others by I have been too busy pining after my true love. If you see Florin please let him join us, I miss his pretty face.
I have had some great moments it would have been nice to share with another so I think I will join you although I must get my fair share of the treasure.
Yes I will join you, my axe is not finished yet.
I have taken it upon myself to scope out the lands and learn more about the invading forces.
I may be old but with a bottle of rum in me I am as good as new.
I also think you could use my knowledge so I will accept your offer.

Listen here {playername}. I did not join this company to be led by someone who {s21}. Make sure you do not do it again or we will fall out.
{reg33?Madame:Sir} -- I'm not altogether happy that we {s21}. To accept a quest is like an oath and you should make sure it is seen through. I trust you will not let this happen again.

Perhaps it is not my place to say so, {reg33?madame:sir}, but I confess that I am somewhat shocked that we {s21}. Of course I realize that war is cruel, but there is no need to make it more cruel than necessary.
Excuse me {reg33?Madame:Sir}. I am happy to serve you but not if we {s21}, I do not wish to be associated with this kind of action. I am quite alarmed.
If someone gives you a job then you must complete it. This is a first principle. You should not {s21} as it makes you look weak.
Why did you attack those innocent people? This does not look good for your character when you {s21}, I suggest you be very careful.
I was not pleased that you decided to {s21}. You have responsibilities to your men, if you want respect see that they are fulfilled.
{playername} It is a bit much that you {s21}. I know I am guilty of the odd criminal act or two but that is just thieving. What you are doing is crossing the line.
Some may complain that you {s21} but I don't think you should care, I wouldn't.
Yes {playername}, this is will please the Gods. Next time we leave no one alive, not even the children.

I know much more than you about how to be a successful leader and I can tell you now that {s21} is not the way to win the respect of you troops. I know you are relatively new to this but you should know better. I am embarrassed to be led by you.
Bug likes {s21}.
I must protest most vigorously against you {s21}. No honourable leader would actively encourage such an action. I pray you do nothing of the sort again.
I urge you to forget the fact that you {s21} captain. Some might get annoyed but you tried your best which is all one can do.
{reg33?Madame:Sir} -- just so you know my opinion, any commander with sense will not let his company {s21}.I hope you don't mind me speaking so bluntly.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}, We just look weak if we {s21}, we don't want to look weak now do we?
As our leader you should not encourage us to {s21}. Whatever the danger we must face it, not run and hide like halflings.
No captain this is not the way to lead. What are you thinking {s21}, looks like your brains are a tiny as your balls.
You know I don't know much but I have heard that {s21} is not a good thing. Maybe you should stop doing it.

Sometimes you just can't do what people ask you to do captain. It is a tough world and things can prevent even the very best from seeing things through. Do not be disheartened for you will make ammends.
It's a damn shame that you made us {s21} {playername}. We should stand up to our enemies in future.
You should be more careful that {s21} doesn't happen again captain. It doesn't reflect well on any of us.
I know I am hardly the, hic, paragon of righteousness captain. But in future you should not {s21}. That's a low thing to do, either sober, hic, or drunk.
When I joined you {reg33?Madame:Sir} I didn't think that I would be party to {s21}. I am not happy seeing this happen so I urge you to not allow it to happen again.
You really should take care not to {s21} captain. You have a responsibility, please don't forget it.
Looting is just a fact of life isn't it captain. Some people kick up a fuss about it but so many Lords do it so why shouldn't we.
Unless you want me to break you in two I suggest that you never {s21} again.
It is not only looks by which you are judged but also your actions. While you do do things like {s21} you only bring shame on yourself and your company.

Though it is regrettable sometimes you must {s21}. Do not let it weigh too heavily on you as a leader must make tough choices for the greater good.
I did not join your army to fail, Venators are who we are because we succeed. If you do not lead this party properly I will leave.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}, honour is everything and going back on your word does your reputation no good. It also harms the reputation of those under you as well so please do not associate us with this.

It is a terrible thing when a battle leads to {s21} but sometimes a high price must be paid for victory. This is the reality of war.
You know noone said that having fun had to be moral. I know they say ask and you receive but I say take and you shall receive. Plus asking is boring as there is never any fighting that way.

I feel disgusted having to share a party with {s11}. He acts so superior yet has spent his entire life in the service of others, never his own man.
You do yourself dishonour having {s11} in our company. He is a Skaven, a plague on this world, and he is a ruthless killer with no ounce of goodness in him.

{reg33?Madame:Sir}, I appeal to you to relieve {s11} from your service as he is a threat to my life and to others here who he dislikes. You cannot control him or keep him in line, it is only a matter of time.

{reg33?Madame:Sir}, you need to do something about the evil barbarism of {s11}. He tries everything he can to stop me from saving the life and health of your troops and he makes threats to me I fear he will carry out.

I couldn't care less that {s11} hates me, but not being able to kill him is driving me insane. I will honour the mercenary code as you pay well but at least send him away, preferably to a task he can't possibly survive.
{s11} may be virtuous but he is a poor judge of character. He continually insults my character but he knows nothing of my world or the work I do.
I had heard of this {s11} character before I joined your party. Most people have and his reputation is certainly formidable but after spending some time with him I am left quite underwhelmed.
Do you know how much money {s11} makes. He even takes a tithe from his venators just for using his name, and they call me a thief.
Is hiring {s11} some kind of joke. You can be questionable as a leader at the best of times but you look like a fool having him in your employment.
If some of our troops are close to death then let them die. There is honour in death, {s11} dishonours the Gods by doing his healing and surgery.
When I leave I will pay you a handsome sum if you release {s11} as well. I will have my troops ready to take him back to the black towers for torture and eventual death.
Booooooooooooooooooooooooooo {s11}, Bug wants to slice and dice.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}, I understand that not everyone aspires to the same code as me but there is a limit to what I will tolerate and {s11} is that limit.
Captain I am most upset with {s11} being in our group. I have only just got over the great evil he committed against me and now seeing his face every day is bringing it all back.

The reason I have respect for all cultures and races is that behind the rituals, beliefs and psychological particulars there are many similarities between us all and at our base we are not so different. There is alot to admire in most races and individuals.
I know that I am not as effective on the battlefield as others here but I feel that any criticisms should come from you and not {s11} as you are my leader.

{playername} I object to that drunken dwarf {s11} being in this crew with us. He never does anything anyone tells him, I have even seen him ignore some of your orders recently. He is a law unto himself.

I must admit it is fun winding up Florin but at the same time he is a pathetic pain in the arse. Men have this complex where they have to be thought of highly and they have to be better than there peers, especially women.
For a race so territorial it is funny how they always encroach upon our territories in the Amazon. They are hypocrites and {s11} is the biggest one of them all.
When I said I would join you I didn't think I would have to spend any time with {s11}. She is a liar and a cheat and she owes me a lot of money.
Excuse me Captain but can I ask that {s11} be formally dismissed. He has offended me greatly as well as being an all round untrustworthy companion.
Captain I have my respect for the skills of the fighting women of Amazonia but not for {s11}. She is lightweight and also incredibly ignorant
You know Captain that {s11} is not a very good sport. I mean her no harm in my compliments, it's just when a fine single lady is in my presence why would I not turn on the Bastich charm.
I know that I am not as effective on the battlefield as others but I feel that any criticisms should come from you and not {s11} as you are my leader.

One moment Captain. I know strength and power are extremely useful for an ambitious leader such as yourself but intelligence is also an important attribute and I fear that {s11} is far too lacking in that area.
Why Thrud get more respect than me? Everyone speaks of him like he is a God yet no one sees that I am the best fighter in your party.
You are supposed to destroy the undead not have them fight with us, especially their best troops.
The chaos have been invading the Empire for generations at the cost of tens of thousands of lives. They are dirty fighters and relentless and I have hated them since I was a young boy.

I just don't like that {s11}.
I just don't like that {s11}.
I just don't like that {s11}.
I just don't like that {s11}.
I just don't like that {s11}.
He has a company the size of an army yet his only ambition is to split them up and work for a few golden coins. If he were the man he says he is he would go out a forge a kingdom for himself.
We have enough good fighters here to win the day, we should not tolerate this hateful scum any longer.
He is also a fiend of Chaos, a Were bear and he harms your reputation being one of your companions. I have heard mutterings against you in markets solely because of his presence.

In recent battles he has held me back from doing my medical work and he even smashed the skull of a soldier right before I was about to treat him. I could have saved him and these are your men, you need to do something!
He may be handy with words but I am handy with a blade, I swear one day I will slay him and burn his body in all those stupid books he writes. the flames will be seen for miles.

He spends so much of his life talking, I spend it acting. I fight the most dangerous of threats and sometimes I have to do things many wouldn't dare to get the job done. It may give the wrong impression of me but my honour is unquestionable when you see the amount of lives I have saved and what I have sacrificed.

He is clearly head and shoulders above everyone else in hand to hand combat but he has no leadership skills, no tactical mind and no ability to inspire others. There is more to the art of war than butchery.

So yes I will take from his basket from time to time. He travels a lot so he has some great food, including the best cheese, sausages and honey. We all have to eat and the least he can do with all his wealth is stop moaning.

I shouldn't have to be worrying about my gold and possessions while I am in your service but he has a funny way of ending up with things which are not his, especially my food. If I catch him red handed by the Gods you must let me kill him.
Many years ago we turned countered an ambush by an Orc horde and he stole 2 kills from me with his unGodly skills. Banish him or I will cut off his hands the next chance we get.

He came very close to wiping out all the Witch Elves but I was able to get them to safety in time thanks to my able fleet. I know he is one sacrifice the Witch Elves would go crazy for. I would order it now but I am respecting your leadership for the meantime.
Beware where he treads, because i'm on my meds, crack on the head and Abdul's dead! Wooooooooooooooompop.

He takes the word knight and turns it into an abomination, his battlefield conduct is a disgrace and he continuously murders knights of Bretonnia for no justifiable reason. There is a warrant out for him in my country, if I was not bound to your service I would take him in.

He killed my horse Captain, my finest horse and greatest friend. I was on a mission to prove how good my horses are by riding from Miragliano to Copher in 3 days and along the way when we were at full speed I saw an arrow spear his head and he died instantly. He said it was an accident but I know Jalil by reputation and he doesn't miss. He shouldn't have fired anyway, it is a travesty.

There are exceptions though and {s11} is one of them. He is fool and there is nothing to learn from him at all. He spends his whole life high on mad cap and you can never understand a word he says. He doesn't even try to communicate or find companionship with anyone. He is a waste of space.

He is constantly examining and assessing my ability and is trying to force me to understand techniques and concepts. In the old days maybe I could take this but not now. I have been taught my own techniques by Rictus and I fight in my own way. I am not the weakling he remembers.

His brewery is just over the mountains from my kingdom and we keep catching him using our forests as short cuts for his deliveries to Brionne. We have caught him and told him many times that he cannot do it but he keeps trying to sneak through rather than go around the authorised route. I would have him strung up but Orion just asks that his deliverers be sent back as he wants to avoid too big a diplomatic situation. Why would you want someone under your command who doesn't listen?

He sees himself as a really dandy adventurer full of cunning and wit but I have taken more money off him at cards and knocked him about more times than I care to remember. He always used to take the same quests as me just so he could do it first but he never has, hahahaha, not even once.

The Lizardmen think they are superior although they try to hide it unlike the Dark Elves who are open about their contempt for others. Just because reptiles thrive in our jungle it doesn't mean that they are welcome to come and go as they please.
I am an expert at cards but she, she! has something up her sleeve. I don't know what it is but it is definitely not legitimate as she always knows what I have. Look at her grinning now, bitch.

I was fond of him when I first met him, he always got into trouble but he was always fun to be around. I let him build up a big tab due to his constant financial problems and he always promised to pay me back. He has not however and he has refused to pay the debt for a year now, I would have strangled him if I didn't have more important matters to attend to. Even now you are paying him he still says I will get no money until he is ready to pay. What kind of honour is that.
She calls me a hypocrite because Lizardmen often spend time in Amazonia but she needs to understand that they are the guests, not us. Our kind was there long before they were.
She gets all angry and standoffish with me, she needs to lighten up. It's my birthday soon captain, maybe you can tell her to give me a kiss as a present.

He is constantly examining and assessing my ability and is trying to force me to understand techniques and concepts I am not ready for yet. I will learn to be a valuable fighter but I can't be unrealistically rushed and certainly not by him.

I know that Ogres tend to live in their own little world in their heads but {s11} really has no understanding of anything. Just now he picked up some leafs and told the troops a story about how he saved a badly wounded ladies life by unlocking their secret healing power and using them as a dressing with water and string. They were bay leaves captain, bay leaves. I fear that his very presence is actually making our troops dumber.
He is strong for a human and tough yes but he is not as strong or as tough as an ogre, let alone the best of them..... me!
It does not matter that he used to be a part of the Empire, he is a tomb King now and you should either disband him or let me kill him.

I always wondered how they become so strong and it is because of people like Erasmus. So cold and calculated his methods are, does he even care how many innocent people die by his work? It would be a mercy on the Empire if he were to die today.

I can't agree with the way they do things.
I can't agree with the way they do things.
I can't agree with the way they do things.
I can't agree with the way they do things.
I can't agree with the way they do things.
Why by Grungi's beard is {s11} in our company. We are not a charity, this is serious business.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}. I don't like the intentions of our companion Eketi. His mission is to give the Dark Elves total dominance of the seas but this would be a very bad thing.

{reg33?Madame:Sir}. Sometimes in life we all make mistakes, none of us are flawless I am sure you will agree. Admittedly I caused great upset to Maephilin by killing one of his horses but I am truely sorry, I really am but he will not let it go, not even for a day.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}. If there is one thing which I have done it is surely shown my trustworthiness and that I am genuine. Most in our party can see this but {s11} just will not accept it.

I have always found the tongues of Elves irritating, but listening to Maephilin singing all day long is making me want to slit my own throat. The Elvish language sounds sophisticated but really they are just saying the same stuff we all say in an overly pretentious way.

My lord. It enrages me to have {s11} in our company. I wouldn't even need to be here if it wasn't for him. We had the Witch Elves on the run and virtually beaten. I sent out a fleet to cut them off at the ocean and when we arrived on the beach I expected them all to be dead.
{playername} you must do something about {s11} at once! Skill is a talent needed on the battlefield but so is discipline and he has none.
You know I love goats cheese and I will go to any lengths to get the best. Unfortunately the best means I have to get near that nasty piece of vermin Skeezle.
Of all the cuddly virtues ever created by this planets inhabitants honour and chivalry have to be the worst.
{s11} seems very proud that no would be assassin has managed to get past him while he has been a personal bodyguard. I can tell you now that I would have no problem getting past him.

I have always considered humans as a low rank of species but none are lower than Felix Jaegar. He thinks that because he reads and can use his language expressively that he knows more than you or I and that his opinions matter more as well.
Hack slash, bash bash bash. Stupid Braganza

{reg33?Madame:Sir}, if you are going to have big personalities in this army then you could find some more amiable than {s11}. He says he achieves nothing but good and that the end result is all that counts but how one conducts oneself matters also.
Captain. {s11} is making me incredibly nervous in battle. I was dehorsed in that last battle and he looked at me with such a menacing face, like I was the enemy.

Throughout my studies I have got a good nose on who to trust and who not to trust. It may seem unusual as many seem to like him but I don't trust Oggy. Orcs are not like other races, they have one of the most primitive minds and are not programmed for intuition and creativity.
I an finding {s11} an insufferable companion. I don't have much to look forward to in life but at least I have my cheese or at least had some cheese, {s11} stole it.

{playername} that is the 5th time now I have asked {s11} to cover my back in battle and she has run off looking only out for herself. I have had more than enough trouble from her over the years and the last thing I want is to be cut down because she will not work as a team.

Don't you ever want to just give {s11} a slap captain, or maybe just shake him out of his dull serious existence. A lizardman's smile is hardly endearing but it wouldn't hurt to crack one every now and again.
I can't stand that {s11}, he is always coming onto me and trying to fawn over me with his stinking stupid self. He is always drunk and while he is harmless he is getting too much for me.
How much longer is {s11} going to be travelling with us? He will not be quiet about my weekly wage and the debt I owe him.

That Elf {s11} is a fine warrior but he is far too serious if you know what I mean. Even after the tragedies that have befallen me I know how to be merry and how to cut good folk some slack from time to time.
You need to be careful who you trust captain. That {s11} will betray you the second she sees the glint of gold in her eye.
I know I am not as quick of body or mind as I used to be but I am an elder and God damn I deserve to be respected. BELCH!
I normally would not trouble you with complaints of others but I feel it is getting dangerous to have {s11} in the party with us.

Of all the foul things which Nagash did, the birth of the tomb Kings had to be the worst of them, They were resting peacefully until he laid a curse upon the land and awoke one of the most powerful factions in the world.
Everyone thinks that Ogres are so dumb and that humans are smart but they are not so smart, especially the chaos. They can be as stupid as a troll.
I have killed more Ogres in the last 2 years than humans Uggluk has killed in his entire life. He is a weak fighter who cannot even beat the laziest tyrant in existence.
Must you have someone quite as brutal as Thrud in our party? His brain is full off 100% violence and nothing else. He is as thick as an Ent's trunk and has no redeeming qualities.
That {s11}...
That {s11}...
That {s11}...
That {s11}...
That {s11}...

Don't be fooled into thinking he is a competent warrior just because of his equipment. He will always be the pathetic little rodent I knew when he was younger. He is nothing but a burden to those around him and that includes you. Just be rid of him.

They are evil and have no respect for anyone but their own kin who they see as vastly superior to all. The only faction they are willing to keep pacts and promises with is Skaven and that says enough in itself. If he is successful the world will turn into a frightful place.

You see I was on high alert protecting my employer and Maephilin came charging down the path with his bow in hand. I tried to fire a warning shot across the front of the horse but I misjudged it's speed. I had never seen a horse this fast so I was not aware my shot was possibly a danger but it speared through the horses head and killed it. I have apologised 1000 times but now I am frustrated, please tell him to let it go or leave.

He keeps watching me, like he is observing my behaviour and when I asked him why he said he was waiting for me to show my true colours. When he is sharpening his arrows he always gives me glances, it makes me nervous. He is an intelligent man too and others respect him for that. I am worried that others will start to believe his theories about me.

Queekish is short, sharp and to the point. Words are often pointless anyway. He says he is going to sing of his favourite place in the world tomorrow, I swear once I am done here I will go and release a pestilence there and leave it to rot and decay.

What we didn't count on was Eketi bringing in the entire Dark Elf fleet, annihilating our own, killing most of men on the beaches and escorting the Witch Elves to the new world. Now he aims to make them stronger, which means if we fail now we may never get another chance.

He doesn't listen to orders and has no style to speak of. He doesn't know the meaning of the words stealth or halt and you cannot depend on him for anything. With such ill discipline he is a hinderance rather than a help to your cause.

He stinks, his stuff stinks and touch the wrong thing and you can catch some festering plague we have not even heard of in the moot. Plus he is an insufferable character in himself, he would be better off out of the party, especially now I have all his cheese and there is no use for him.

You can see by his beam how proud Sir Aristide is of his virtuous life. The man is a joke, you only get half of what you need to do done when you live by such rules. Find an enemy and destroy them, by any means, that is the easiest and most definitive way.

I would kill him and all the other bodyguards first and then walk past his lifeless corpse to claim the skull of his master. No need for stealth or cunning, just take them all out. I would take extra pleasure in killing him as I hate the cowards who are so proud of their ranged weapon skills. A real warrior fights toe to toe.

He hates us as well as the Skaven. Hate isn't a bad thing but he doesn't know how to use it. He isn't even that good a fighter, he isn't much good at anything that isn't self indulgent. He is more pathetic than superior.
He will kill me when I awake but maybe when he sleeps? Bug scared, needs more medicine.

I have heard stories of him leaving people to die, destroying cultural artefacts and using dishonesty and manipulation to achieve his goals. Yes he may have prevented evil from prevailing but at what cost? At the cost of honour and what makes us a blessed race.
I thought for a minute he was going to jump at me but he seemed to restrain himself. I have never given him any reason to feel ill at me, in fact we have barely spoken. Please have a word with him.

His love for medicine is unusual, too unusual for an Orc and I fear there is something wrong with his brain. It may be damaged or under some kind of spell and if that is the case then he could switch at any minute and do something unpredictable, maybe even dangerous. I have seen Orcs with brain problems suffer fits of psychosis and there are always deaths. He may seem normal but trust me Orcs should not act like this.
It was the best goats cheese you can eat and nowhere we are visiting has anything close for sale and most of the good shops won't even sell it to me. Why is my life so depressing.

She has a talent for tracking and she does it stealthily for a human but over the years she seemed to think our forests welcome her when they do not. She was always trying to sneak in and whilst she can elude some of our rangers she cannot elude me. 3 times she has been in prison yet she still illegally returns to our forests. I suggest you get in someone more trustworthy.

Oh the injustice, oh the troubles my kin face, that is all you hear from him. You would think that the Lizardmen were the only race in the world to have problems. He needs to get laid but that might risk a {s11} offspring which doesn't bear to think about.
I fell over in that last battle and he could see I was ok yet he ran over to give me the kiss of life. It was so unnecessary and I can still taste it now.

I know I owe him money but I owe others money too and I intend to pay them off first. Some of the characters I am in debt to are a lot more concerning than Joseph Bugman if you know what I mean. He will get his money he just has to wait, will you help me get that through to him?

{s11} is probably the most unwelcoming souls you could meet. There is a reason he is often on his own when we camp yet many flock to sit with me. For every bit of morale his crack shot arrows give us, his hostile demeanour takes right away.
I know you pay her well but for {s11} no amount is enough. She will always go after the bigger prize no matter where her loyalties should lie.
{s11} is too concerned about what I am doing and not enough about what she is doing. Better whip her up into shape Captain, quick smart.
The problem is that, to be frank.... well it's the smell. He stinks and he gives away our position from a mile off. One day he will attract the wrong kind of beast at us and we will be done for.
They are a plague upon the world and they are hated by all which is why I advise you to release {s11} from your company. He is no good for army morale.

Erasmus is the stupidest of them all. He think he can train me to be better and that some of my fighting style is wrong or energy inefficient as he puts it whatever that means. He can teach me nothing, I am a killer and I could crush him to prove it.
I get the feeling he wants to fight me, if he challenges me to a duel I will take his head off of his shoulders. You can take compensation from my wages.

I understand you need great fighters but there are others out there like Gotrek or Sir Aristide who will think before they shed blood. That is just as key a talent as Thrud's kill now, leave the consequences to everybody else.

I can't stand watching them fight.
I can't stand watching them fight.
I can't stand watching them fight.
I can't stand watching them fight.
I can't stand watching them fight.
Another fine victory, the wetter my axe the better. It am glad to see the manling {s11} fighting by my side again as well.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}. I am indebted to you for bring {s11} along with us on our quests. I am bound to him by an unbreakable oath and while he is here I am fulfilling both my duty to him and to you.
Hello, {reg33?madame:sir}! I had just wanted to tell you that {s11} is a wonderful companion to have with us. If there is one thing I admire it is focus and he has it in abundance.
A toast to your victory {reg33?madame:sir}. We looked determined out there, especially {s11}. It may seem weird that someone as soft as I favours a killer as cold as {s11} but I owe him a lot.

An efficient skirmish master. Our enemies were quick to fall to the floor. {s11}'s healing skills have also helped us recently, as distasteful as his lack of fighting skill is we need as many troops battle ready as possible to fulfil our missions.

You have done me a good deed by taking {s11} into our company. I admire men who live a life of protecting others. From a very early age he decided to dedicating his life to protecting those who are vital to his country.
Although he has never got much respect from others I must admit that I have a level of admiration for {s11}.
A fine battle that was {playername}. And I have to say, I admire watching {s11} leading the charge in battle, he is truly amazing.
Battles are fun when you fight next to {s11}. He is totally insane! He just goes and does his thing, there is no real method or goal, just hack hack hack.
I normally like remain solitary when we camp but I must admit that I enjoy talking to {s11}. He is a great fighter with big plans of his own.

If you want to go far in this world captain then you have to know how to handle yourself. All Dark Elves are taught how to fight from birth. We have skill and we have emotion and we know to use them. The same can be said for {s11}.
Bug like {s11}.
It is a good thing we have {s11} with us in our group. War can be a depressing thing, that goes without saying. There is always so much at stake that it is hard to know how to raise a smile.
Captain. It is a pleasure travelling with men like {s11} by my side.
I don't get as much time to talk to you as I would like {reg33?Madame:Sir} but I enjoy talking to Maephilin as we have a lot in common.
Most of my idols are Skaven but I have a lot of admiration for {s11} whom I have known by reputation for a long time.

I am not one to look favourably on others but I find {s11} is a good companion to be around. She has done a lot in her life although not all of it is tasteful it must be said. She is charismatic and certainly knows how to whip the lazy troops up to speed.
Serious people are not really my thing but I am becoming fond of {s11}. Pistols will always be my thing but I have a soft spot for archery and he is the best I have seen.
You know every time I see Florin I fall in love all over again. He has the perfect face and body and he is such a courageous and noble man.

Everyone loves to be loved right! and I have that with {s11}. She is really in to me if you know what I mean, all it takes is a short poem or a deep gaze of my eyes and she will do whatever I want for the rest of the day.
You know I love that {s11} captain. It is off characters like him that I made my fame and fortune. An absolute pisshead he is, he out drinks most dwarves I swear it.
Of all the outsiders who come to Lustria {s11} is the most welcome. She is a real traveller, an inquisitive women who admires without touching.
I don't believe in the Gods captain but I believe in {s11}.
I tell you what captain, we are lucky to have {s11} supporting us in the field. I am always worn out after a battle but he always looks like he has just got going.
If there is one warrior who would not benefit from my training it is {s11}, he is already a one man killing machine.

I used to work for Lord Albertus when I was younger and he was a daring adventurer and explorer. He was never fond of the duties which came with being an Empire Lord and just wanted to be, well more like Florin as sad as that sounds.

Erasmus is a good friend to me. I used to train in his pit fighting clubs many years ago. He would also take me on tour to pit fighting tournaments where we would both win lots of money off of my victories.
They say that Ogres make untrustworthy companions but I have never found it so, especially not Uggluk. I used to lead a party not too different from your own and Uggluk was my best warrior.
Jefe. {s11} allí no lo hizo mal en absoluto en la última pelea. Tiene buenas pelotas, también.

Boss. {s11} back there didn't do badly in that last fight at all. Their a good egg, too.
