We are like brothers and although I have saved him from a tight spot many times, he has done me good to. I cannot think of anyone I would rather have write my life story.

When I first started my journeys with Gotrek I thought my time with him would be short. One who looks for death usually finds it quickly in this world. It seems that Gotrek even defies the Gods and while the seemingly never ending nature of my oath can be frustrating, it is exciting to be living the story of one of the greatest slayers ever to have lived.
Whether we are talking about on the battlefield or a wider tactical plan he sees everything through with the utmost precision. I am surprised I hadn't heard of him before he came here to be honest.

He saved my life a few years back while I was trekking through the mountains. I was captured by an angry Dwarf who was going to do all manner of things to me. Ripnitch jumped out of nowhere to attack him and after he saved me he even asked me to tend his wounds so he didn't die. Maybe he isn't so heartless after all?

He helped me out one time near Karak a Karak. I was hired to capture a prestigious Dwarf runesmith and when I caught up to him he had {s11} as a prisoner. I attacked him but I am trained too well and he was greatly wounded. I was about to kill Oggy as well but I saw he had a medical book in his possession so I asked him to see to the Dwarf. Whatever he did worked as the Dwarf survived and my mission was saved.

Even though many will say otherwise I have also dedicated my life to protecting my kin from the evil that walks this world. It is often a thankless task but when you love your country you don't need recognition to know how important you are.

He has worked to improve himself at all costs his whole life and that is an admirable thing. He was always laughed at and mocked when he was weak but he persevered and can hold his own. He will never be mighty but not everyone can be, for his level he has done extremely well.

I don't usually get star struck. I don't care much for the so called legends of the Old World but I must admit Sir Aristide is one I cannot help but admire. Powerful on the battlefield, graceful in manner and authoritative in presence. I have not even stolen anything in his presence so as not to disrespect his virtues and believe me that is a first.
He is a dreamer and you can rarely understand a thing he says. I would love to know what he thinks about all day.

One day he will lead many tens of thousands of Elves to establish dominance of the sea. I will enjoy watching him slaughter his way to power almost as much as I will enjoy taking it off him when after I go home and call forth the great Northern fleet.
It is a shame he is not a Dark Elf because I know Malekith would love to have him do his bidding. He is frightening to watch on the battlefield and I would stand no chance against him.
Bug like you too.

{s11} is a surprising source of positivity. He is always in a good mood and looking to make things easier for others in any way he can. He always respects things he doesn't understand which can't be said about many others. He may not be much of a fighter but some companions can be crucial in other ways.

He is such a learned and intelligent man. I thought I knew a lot about the world but he is knowledge far surpasses mine. He takes such care and attention in examining detail he finds and is very careful in forming his opinions. If you ever need advice about how to deal with other races, I would recommend asking him.

He has travelled a lot just like me and also has a vast knowledge of many things. His views are a bit biased but that is to be expected. He has a knack for song which I envy greatly as well as a voice to match. Musical talent is something Elves have over other races I must admit

Skaven armies are experienced underground or in the field but we are yet to really master the art of sieges like other races have. If our leaders had his knowledge and mind for siege warfare we could change the face of the earth.

She is a bit of an adventurer and a treasure seeker which is the kind I normally hate but she is a sea faring lady and always will be so she will never be a threat to my kingdom as we are far inland. The pirates, just like us, often have to face tough odds to survive and I respect that.

There isn't a better feeling than blowing the head off of an assailing Skaven but sometimes I miss the speed and grace a bow and arrow seems to have. I saw him claim a head shot before the enemy had a chance to move in the last battle.
He always promises me we will be together but he always heads off on adventures but that is his profession so I understand. One day I will marry him though, I am sure of it.

Don't get me wrong I do like her and she is beautiful but ultimately my dream girl needs to be a bit more worldy and battle wise. It is nice to have someone to share the nights with though I won't deny it.

I test my limited edition brews on him all the time. The promise of a few barrels is enough for him to test any formulas for side effects and whatnot. Some weird things have happened to him but he has never complained and I have always got the recipes spot on after his input.

She is very stealthy too. Sometimes we do not know she is in Lustria for a few days after she has arrived. She is very knowledgeable and respectful and she has dined with Reverend Itzatecah on a few occasions such is her standing. You see lizardmen are not aggressive to all outsiders, just the ones who come to fill their pockets.
His brew is as heavenly and as great a gift as was ever given by a living soul to another. All my pay goes on it you know.

We have been friends for years and I have seen him lead his troops into battle and win against incredible odds. He protects his country intensely just like Scarloc but he does so because others like to come and steal their sacred treasures. That is a valid reason but no one tries to take anything from the Wood Elves yet Scarloc acts in the same way. He is a disgrace compared to {s11}.

He is powerful, direct and absolutely fearless. Tactics, deception and subtlety are not his strong points but they don;t need to be when you can do what he can do. You made a good decision signing him up.
He always treated his troops well and always showed me great respect by giving me the best cuts of meat every meal. It is a shame what happened to him, now there is no meat on him at all.
I have never fought with him in battle before until now and he still has style for an old man.
We fought the Lizardmen who are extremely tough to fight but he was always the one who got us through the tight battles. So long as you keep him well fed he will be nothing but an asset.

We get along really well.
We get along really well.
We get along really well.
We get along really well.
We get along really well.

You have tried your best to find the greatest opponents but I need a greater challenge to fulfil my destiny. I will now leave your company and head to the darkest tombs of Nehekhara in search of a worthy foe.

{reg33?Madame:Sir}, it has been a honour to serve you, but I must admit that my writing has been deeply neglected since I have been in your company and I have so much to put down from memory. So I must return home and begin my works. Maybe when I am done I will see you again.

It has been an honour to protect you it really has. However I am concerned at how slack the bodyguards in our realm are getting at the moment. There have been 15 successful assassinations of high ranking figures in the last 3 months and this is unacceptable. It is my duty to return and persuade them to take me back. I hope you understand.

It has been my life's honour serving in your company {reg33?Madame:Sir}, but the time has come for me to return to my homeland. I have learnt enough from you to stand up for myself so now I will return and hopefully show my kin that there is more to know than how to bash and crack skulls.

You have paid me well and I have gained much fame fighting for you for which I am grateful. Yesterday I received a message from Thanquol himself that he wishes me to become his personal assassin, this is a position I cannot refuse. I leave now, we shall not meet again.
Word has reached me that the Witch Elves are planning on returning to the Old World. I don't know much but I must leave at once for Fort Balderick and begin discussing our response.
I have served you faithfully and I wish you well for your future. However I must return to Miralgiano and summon my my men to me so I can assess our strength and start working as one unit again.

As fun as this conquering malarky is I miss the pleasures of being my own entity, doing what I want when I want. My chances to pilfer are getting less and less so I need to go back to my roots and return home.
I am bored so I am off, you are not the most boring leader I have ever followed but even so, you could have been a bit more aggressive than you have been.
I have received a calling from my Gods to return back home and raise an army in preparation for a great message I will receive on the top of Mount Vanir. I will leave you now.

The time has come captain for me to return as head of my fleet and prepare to launch a full scale assault on the seas. Serving you has been more enjoyable than I thought and if you need a favour in the future let me know, just don't interfere with my plans.
Boo.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}, I have been called to join the crusade by my King the majestic King Leoncouer. I am bound to leave at once but I admire you greatly and hope to see you again.

As happy as I am under your leadership {reg33?Madame:Sir}, the time has come for me to leave your side. Recently the call of my people has been stronger than it usually is, I feel it is time to put down my bow and return home where I can practice more gentle arts. Come and see me again one day, you will always be welcome.

I appreciate that you took me on but my advancement of knowledge has slowed down and I really need to begin my studies again. I will travel to the great Imperial library to study the Wood Elves as I know least about them of all the races.

Captain I have learnt alot under your leadership and am a much better fighter now than I was when I joined. I must leave though to spread my seed and create children from whom to pass on my skills. Farewell Captain and maybe I will join you again.

We both knew this time would eventually come and it has indeed arrived. I have documented all I need to know about the mass immigration and must now return home and report to my King. It was an honour to serve you.

I had been having so much fun that I forgot that my new ship would be ready. It is time I went back and rallied my crew for new adventures. I hear the Dark Elves are up to something well I say bring it on.
We have passed my home a fair few times since I joined you and now I think it is time I went back to my sisters.
I am moving on now to go adventure on my own. I thank you for your company but I have much to do. Farewell my friend.

Well Captain. The furnace inside me has died down and it is time for me to go back to my business. You can come drink with me any time and on the house for sure, it has been a pleasure fighting with you.
Word has reached me that my unit is to be placed back under my command so I must leave immediately. Farewell and thank you.
I am an old man captain and need to retire. It has been an honour serving you in my twilight years.

Captain, I have received word that my sister is very ill and there is no one to care for her since my brothers have all gone off to war. I must leave immediately and look after her, family must come first.

Captain, like all men there comes a time to retire and for me that time has come. I have been in the fighting business for a long time now and the time has come for me to step down. I will go back to the pits and make some money betting on the fights, no one knows the fighters better than me so I expect to be rich in no time.

Well my friend. The time has come for me to go forth and claim my kingdom. I know I said I wanted your help but you have your own mission and this is something I must face with my own army. Goodbye {playername}.
I need to kill bigger monsters and claim greater treasure than I have recently. Your army was fun for a while but now I am bored.

I have busied my mind with your campaigns for a long time now and I am grateful for the opportunity but I need to try and figure out how to reverse this curse so I will go to Nehekhara and see what I can discover.

I've grown tired of serving under you.
I've grown tired of serving under you.
I've grown tired of serving under you.
I've grown tired of serving under you.
I've grown tired of serving under you.
You again. I have killed many Bone Giants since we last met and I am ready to kill again. If you are leaving soon I will rejoin you, just find stronger enemies this time.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}! It's good to see you again. Word has reached my ears of your exploits since I left and it made me miss it very much. Will you have me back?

I found a new master to protect but he was an intolerable immoral fool and I was wroth to save his life. I almost missed a shot deliberately but I held my emotions in and I quit to save my reputation. I would much rather be under your service again?

Hello {reg33?Madame:Sir}. I have travelled far but still you are the only one who is willing to accept my valuable skills. I have been getting very depressed with life recently, if you rehire me I will be even better this time around, even in battle.
You want to rehire me again?.
Greetings {playername}, it has been a while but if you wish for me to return to help your cause I will.
It may just be the drink talking but I wouldn't mind rejoining your party, what do you say?
Hello again {playername}, being your companion is actually more fun than I previously admitted. Shall we let bygones be bygones?
You are a laughable leader but I could do with a good laugh so I will rejoin you.
I am available again if you want my strength.
Captain! While I am still angry at you I like your tendency to force an issue with the enemy. If you want me back I will come but try and be a better leader this time.
Waaaaaagh! Let us fight again.

Our paths cross again {playername}. I left before as I felt you did a dishonour to the virtues I live my life by. I do however believe in redemption and word has reached my ears of some good deeds performed by your hand since we have parted. Maybe your company is a worthy place for me after all.

Well {reg33?Madame:Sir}, I made no secret of my disappointment last time I was in your employment. I did not think we would work together again but I must confess that the distances and locations we travelled to were thrilling, especially for one who likes to see as much of nature as I. If you require my bow once more then it is yours.

Why hello, {playername}. I can't say I'm entirely displeased to see you. You see, I took on another contract with another adventurer but he was a bigot and a tyrant so I left as soon as possible. It would be a great relief to return to your party.

Master, it is good that I have bumped into you. After I left you before I thought I was ready to return home, I thought I was trained enough to get vengeance on those who tormented me and to prove myself as a strong skaven. Alas I was wrong as I was beaten by robbers on the path to the border, I guess I have more to learn. I beg you to take me back and teach me some more, I need your help.

I have tried to relax since our last meeting but to have some form of combat mission to undertake is like an instinctual need for me. So if you want me in your company once more then I will come with you.
You're like a bad smell captain, or is Bastich here I don't know, haha, you can't keep away from me can you. As it is I need some excitement so what do you say we hit the road.
Captain! I thought I would do better without you but I was so wrong. Please take me back.
It seems our paths cross again. I was annoyed before but I forgive you for your poor judgement. We all have alot to learn you know so it's alright. You can welcome me back now.
We all say and do crazy things from time to time captain. I am sure if I come back things will work out this time.
Our paths cross again {playername} although things did not end well last time we were together. I still respect you as a leader and hold you in high esteem despite our disagreement.
You want me back?.

Have you noticed an increase in hostilities all over the world {playername}? I have had some close calls in areas I always felt perfectly safe in. I know we parted on unusual terms but if you would rehire me I will be grateful.
Good to see you again captain, I hear your troops have slacked a bit recently, you need me to whip them into shape.
You let me down last time you goat's anus, you should have respected my wishes. However I am still not ready to return to my home so if you need my help any time I am on your side.
You need Thrud then Thrud is ready to go.
Not many patrons want to drink with me any more. Is there any room left in your party?

After traveling for a while, I realised my place is with you.
After traveling for a while, I realised my place is with you.
After traveling for a while, I realised my place is with you.
After traveling for a while, I realised my place is with you.
After traveling for a while, I realised my place is with you.

I know the Chaos wastlelands very well, especially the north. If you know where to search and have the stomach for it then some of the deadliest creatures ever to walk the earth can be found in these parts.
We are near Altdorf, if we go in I must keep a low profile as they may still have not forgotten me. I will certainly never forget the city, it is where I first met Gotrek.

Can you smell that? Spiced incense, fresh fruit and the gorgeous smell of the tagine, it's the scent of Copher. I spent many a happy summer here when I was a boy, practicing archery and listening to the wise old men tell me tales of the past.
Begging your pardon {reg33?Madame:Sir}, but I thought you might like to know we are close to my home tribe in Gutrot.
I slew my first ever victim not far from here captain. The city of Skavenblight and its borderlands are dangerous areas. You need eyes on the back of your head.
This is the home base of my organisation in the New World. I have many men spread around the Empire waiting to return here when we have more news.
Power is such a fragile thing in Tilea, it is almost foolhardy to try and be a ruler as chances are you won't last too long in your position of riches and power.
We are near one of my lifes goals, Texcolo! Lustria is full of riches and it is rumoured that somewhere in Texcolo is a dungeon with an ancient treasure horde deep inside .

We fought one of our greatest battles on this ground 5 years ago. About 50 of us had just finished a 3 day drinking session and the Empire must have got wind as they sent an army to ambush us, I imagine to catch us off guard and out of sorts.
The great men of the North are forever at war with each other; wars for supremacy, wars for pride and wars for blood.
Us Dark Elves have always been a seafaring race. Our corsairs haven't got the reputation they have for no reason and Lord Fellheart is the most feared of all the sea faring commanders.
Captain I feel slightly sober so I think now is the time to tell you that we are near my home of Stinkinz.
Hail the city of my King, the noble and majestic King Louen Leoncour.
Begging your pardon {reg33?Madame:Sir}, I thought I would mention that we are close to my home in Tor Elyr.
We are near my home of Tanis, a beautiful place and one of the unsung trade hubs of my people. I don't spend a lot of time there due to my travelling but there is a big place in my heart for my home.
My home master is a place called Putrid Lair near the frontline stronghold of Foul Peak.
We are close to my home and the forests which I have defended my whole life.

I was found here near Pirate King Fortress Captain. I say found because I don't know who my parents are or where I was actually born. I was abandoned on the deck of a ship when I was a baby and left for whoever would find me.
We are near my home and also the part of the jungle where I met Florin for the first time.
My birthplace {playername} is the Bretonnian castle of Bastonne.

Let me tell you about my home captain, my beloved brewery. It is large with the sound of machinery making a din at all hours of the day. The smell of alcohol and hops gets in your beard and in your clothes and there is always a merry atmosphere with much singing and joking by my workers.
We are near my home land of Xahutec, like most travellers I have not spent much time there in the last few years.
We are near my old home captain. I left my family 42 years ago to get pissed on the open sea. They must wonder where on earth I am, maybe I should go let them know.
We are near the quiet village of Middenstag My cousin is part of the international trade guild which is based here so I stay here whenever I need to rest in one place for a long time.
We are near my home of Mount Vanir where I was taught how to fight. My success here gave me a thirst for more so I decided it was best for my career if I moved to Mordheim and made my name there.
We are near aarvik, the first places I travelled to when I first came to this part of the world. The main force of the army I will raise will come from the chaos wastelands.
I was born near here. My mother abandoned me in a tavern and a group of mercenaries claimed me for their own.
I used to be the Lord of this here land. I was a good Lord, one who looked after his people and served the Emperor faithfully.

This reminds me of my home.
This reminds me of my home.

This reminds me of my home.
This reminds me of my home.

I always hear warriors claim to have fought the best, I imagine you believe some of your fights have been historic. But let me tell you now that until you have gone toe to toe with a Bloodthirster you will not know what it is like to fight true power.

The Empire likes to be pioneers when it comes to technology but when it comes to laws we often get it all wrong. The Emporer had put in place a window tax, can you belive it? charging a citizen just to view these beautiful lands from our own houses. I was outraged and whipped up a sterling protest to which the official response was to send in troops.

The weather is always stable here however so I had to leave my home. If you want to learn to fire an arrow accurately at range in high winds then Copher is not the place to do it. I spent alot of the times in the mountains as the weather there is atrocious and I learnt much practicing in that climate. I came back as the best shot in the city.

I learnt to speak Riekspiel from merchants while I was very young. While my tribe was either squabbling with each other or preparing to give Bonerencha camp another bashing I used to sneak into the Imperial Lands, sometimes as far as Talabheim and try to find some literature. It is there I found books on anatomy and physiology and what surprised me more than my desire to read it was how well I understood it.

Seer Kruekel had called all available assassins in for a special assignment. Only one assassin was to get the job and it was given to one with not even half the skill I possess. The target was was an Orc warboss in Karak Vlag who, according to our spies, was trying to persuade Garbalu to expand into Skaven territory. An easy target which should have been given to me in the first place.

We nearly won the first time. We took the Witch Elves completely by surprise in one of their outdoor rituals. Most of their population was there and we descended on them with all the anger in our hearts and will in our minds. There was so much smoke from our firearms you could have seen it from the Empire.

Look at all the merchant Princes now, all disposed by the pirates. It won't be long before they are destroyed as well. The best thing you can be in Tilea is an elite mercenary, you can have riches and position in society without fear of being plotted against. I am seen as a resource in the game of power, nothing more.
It used to be a base for the skaven in the dark early days, who knows what remains down there but one day I plan to find out.

What they did not realise is that we fight just as well drunk or hungover as we do when sober and nothing gets us more riled and determined than being pitted against units of Imperial or Bretonnian knights.

It was not until I took some of my men into the northern lands of the Empire that I realised that we had been holding ourselves back from a source of even greater bloodshed and pillage. Our lands are small compared to the rest of the World, we must take our armies south and slaughter all in our path.

Lord Fellheart has chosen me for a very important mission before the big campaign. I have to learn all the secret pirate coves and lairs so we know where to hit hardest. I have already learnt a lot whilst travelling with you. Our invasion will be victorious and absolute.
To be honest I cannot remember much of my past, it is all a blur.

Couronne is my City as well. I won many tournaments in Couronne's arena, the most prestigious tournaments around and run by the King himself. I impressed him with my fighting skill and good graces and he awarded me the title 'master of the tournaments', a title of which I am both humbled and honoured.

The fields and hills in that part of Ulthuan are the finest to learn the mastery of horses. We breed some of the fastest horses ever seen and I have been riding them since I was very young. I believe that horses are closer to the Gods than any other animal.

It is normally a very safe place apart from occasional raid by the Tomb Kings which can leave this defensively weak part of our kingdom in ruins. I respect all the kingdoms in this land apart from the Tomb Kings who I hate with a passion. Words cannot express my feelings towards them.
It is a requirement to be tough with the Stronghold being on the border of what was the Wood Elf lands. Anyone who shows weakness is ridiculed and I was the worse of them.

My kin have lived there for a long time and we have a special bond with forests. There are many who believe we are too territorial but when you see the desecration that befalls other lands in times of conflict you will understand why we are so desperate to keep our forests free of any potential threats.
Luckily for me the ship was owned by one of the most fearsome captains of his time and he raised me up by himself and taught me everything I need to know about how to survive in this world.

I was just going for a walk and he was looking for a magic stone. We sat and talked for hours, he told me of his adventures and all the courageous things he has done in his life. He is the perfect man don't you think?

My mother hid me in a caravan during the red pox outbreak caused by Clan Eshin which destroyed the population. There was a quarantine and no unauthorised personnel were allowed in or out of the castle. My mother was resourceful though and she smuggled me away. She died along with the rest of my family but I always give thanks to her for saving my life.

There are many secrets in this world {playername} and the recipe to my XXXXXX is one of them. I created the recipe after years and years of study and toil and the result is the most popular brew in all of history.
After we destroyed the great Chaos threat in the south we thought we had earned the respect of the whole world but to our horror we were then the ones being invaded.
On second thoughts you don't have time for that captain, another time maybe. I am from here though, I used to sell goods on the road from the stuff my brother would take from the Elven ships.

I am suspicious of what the guild does but I keep my mouth shut. My cousin says it wants to share technology with the new world in exchange for resources but I fear we will take but give nothing back.

My father taught me how to use every kind of hand held weapon. He died while I was young but not before I had learnt enough to be able to hold my own and protect my family against the Empire. I stayed and fought until I heard about the pit fights in Mordheim and the money and respect that comes from being victorious there.

A chaos army will not care about your cause but it will fight against your enemies like they are fighting for Archaon himself. The tyrant who rules my kingdom is gluttonous and has failed to uphold our status in relation to the other tribes.

They taught me to fight and then sent me to the greatest fighting school to master my trade. When I was 5 I got expelled for killing 27 pupils and 3 teachers so I ran into the wilderness and taught myself everything else I needed to learn.

When I returned I proved without a shadow of a doubt that I am who I say I am but they chose not to listen. Even men I would call my brothers denied me even though I could see in their eyes that they knew.

Being here makes me feel nostalgic.
Being here makes me feel nostalgic.
Being here makes me feel nostalgic.

Being here makes me feel nostalgic.

I have slain these beasts, I have slain whatever Khorne, Tzeentch, Slaanesh and Nurgle have thrown at me. I wonder if there is a foe out there capable of taking my life or if I will end up dying of old age. I would go after Nagash if I knew where he is but he has not been seen or heard of in decades.

It was probably foolish of me but I charged the troops head on and Gotrek, who admires such stupidity, dived in to save me despite not knowing me at all. We celebrated his victory, as it wasn't really mine, at the Screaming Cat tavern. In a drunken stupor I vowed to follow him around until he is slain and then write about his life. It is a seemingly neverending quest and I fear that whatever kills Gotrek will make short work of me, the books may never be written after all.

I couldn't have come a moment to soon though as political turmoil meant many prominent figures were getting killed. I stepped up to help and in a way it stole my childhood but I had a responsibility and I wouldn't be the man I am today if I stood by and did nothing.

My tribe always used to call me manlike much to my shame and when they found out how much alike I was hounded out my village. Word spread around the kingdom and soon there was no Orc that did not know and ridicule me for my passions. I thought getting a job as an apothecary for the Gouged Eye team would earn me some respect but it only made things worse. Orcs just have no concern for the powers of healing.

I followed the assassin and as he crept through Sleekit I took my chance and went for him. We fought briefly on the bridge but I was too fast for him. I cast his body down the river and personally undertook his mission to kill the warboss. News came through of my success to Kruekel and he rewarded me with more work. Being on Kruekel's personal killteam is a good position to start your career in, now I am here with you which will be equally prosperous.

Those that survived fled for Hag Graef but little did they know that we had besieged half the city and had an army outside the gates. They then fled for the coast as we predicted but Eketi thwarted what we thought was the final act.
I should not be too critical of those who aspire for power as they are my potential employers and the last 8 years have been very lucrative for me. There are wars everywhere.

Sadly with the Saurus paranoia at its most neurotic it can be really hard to get this far into Lustria without being marched out again or worse. I will try and get my hands on a good map showing the least beaten paths and use those.

We spotted their ambush and charged them head causing many casualties in the first hit. The battle was scattered and disorganised from there but we had the best of it and forced a retreat of the Imperial army back to Averheim. Hahahaha, I will never let them forget it.

I took my army all the way down to the border princes and into the badlands before we were finally forced back. The next time we tried the Empire was more prepared but we love a challenge and the war continues.
Once we have control of the seas we would have effectively split the world in two which will make it much easier to move towards widespread conquest.
All I know is that I discovered mad cap and that was that. Speaking of which where is my stash..............

I fought side by side with the King in the Battle of Swamphold, a last stand against the mighty Orc invasion and arguably the Kings finest hour. Since that battle he has trusted me with his life, he trusts me above all others, and he trusts me now to fulfill my duty and bring back the blessed banner and secure our nations safety forever.

I never wanted to be a warrior, I wanted to breed horses but the Dark Elf threat mobilised the entire island 50 years ago and I decided to join the Reavers but that did not work out because you need to be great with a lance as well as a bow. I am a mighty fine horse archer though as I am sure you can see.

They are pure evil with no positive features about them. They are a kingdom of merciless expansionists who have no care for the beliefs and rights of other kingdoms. There only desire is to destroy, to kill as many inhabitants of this world as they can. They want everyone dead, just like them.'

My life was hard but in times of intense war I was glad to be on the mountains. There is much Clan Moulder and many rat ogres on Foul Peak and the Wood Elves would often leave us alone and head for Mordheim. I am glad there are no Wood Elves here anymore.

The rumours that no one is ever allowed in are unfounded, you for example would be welcome in our lands. We are however stricter than other kingdoms and we do it for good reason. It is not just us that wishes our land to be so protected but the forest itself wills us to be vigilante. You can hear her wailing when she is at unease, the recent disaster is the great tragedy of our time.
Most men don't realise, they just see a pretty face or think I am in fancy dress but they soon find out. My father told me everything about male anatomy, it was very enlightening, hahaha.
I hear stories from others about him doing some pretty cunning and dishonest things but they must be mistaken. My Florin is a paragon of virtue, and a great kisser.

Growing up without a family is hard but not unusual considering the world we live in. I travelled the world and learnt much whilst in my teenage years, I took whatever I could from each culture to better my ability to provide for myself in any circumstance. You may not think it but I am a wily old fox at the best of times, I just get in over my head every now and again.

Being a brewer is more than just my passion, it is my duty. Many dwarf armies have been galvanised by a night on my brew on the eve before battle. It is an important part of dwarf culture, which is why the whole kingdom rallied in anger to the goblin raid which caused such devastation to my home.
The Tileans were the worst of them all, they gained the most from our victories. We gave them their land back from the Chaos yet they came here to expand their territory. It is unforgivable.
It was a good living but it got dangerous and my wife was driving me mad with her incessant nagging whenever I got home. I got a chance to join a prestigious ship one day and left by the back door.
Most of the nations in that part of the world don't want us there or our knowledge. We should leave but more traders and their mercenaries turn up every day.

Since I joined I only ever lost twice, once to an ogre and another time to a Black Orc Big Boss. I made full recoveries and since then I am unbeaten. Once I had retired from fighting I stayed on as head trainer at Thanquol's request. He wanted Mordheim to train the best fighters to keep more money running in than at other cities. That is what I did {playername}, Mordheim pit fighters are the fiercest in the world.

Our tribe was held in high esteem in the days of my father, now the others call us 'tanfuksham gajum' which means 'almighty sleep' in orcish, because our tyrant is lazy and has us do nothing. I wish to change things back to the way things were and reclaim our status among the tribes. It will be a tough mission as despite his lethargy our tyrant beat me before, and beat me well. I will be better prepared this time.
Since then I have had killed over 10,000 enemies, or so they say, I am not good with numbers.

Since then they have all laid claim to my land and my riches. I have lost everything, material, social and spiritual. If my loyalty to the Emperor was not so strong I would have a good mind to raise an army and take it all back.

I travel the world seeking out the mightiest foes in battle, that is all you need to know.
I am a merchant's son from Altdorf but fled after the tax riots. I am also a poet and am bound to Gotrek by oath after a nights heavy drinking.
I am a former bodyguard who is famed throughout Araby for never letting an assassin within close range of my master.
I am a skilled healer and surgeon from Gorrut camp who was disowned by my tribe for being weak. They seem to forget that my talents give strength to others who may have lost it.
I am a skilled assassin from Hellpit and I am an efficient killer. That is all you need know.
I am Mathias Thulmann and Master Witch Hunter. I am here to banish evil and to destroy the Witch Elves.
I am Braganza, elite mercenary at your service.
I am from the moot but I spend most of my time away so that I can borrow stuff from around the world.
I don't care about where I am from or you are from, all that matter is the here and now.
I am the Beorg, leader of the Bearmen of Urslo.
I am a Naval commander under the guidance of Lord Fellheart. My mission is to discover all I can about the pirates before we launch a sea invasion.
Brrtnik dnazt reeeeeeek.
I am from Couronne but am based in Lacombe currently while we prepare for the King's crusade against Araby and the Tomb Kings.
I am an archer and lover of horses, nothing too exciting {reg33?madame:sir}.
I am from the beautiful castle of Marrakech in the mighty Kingdom of Araby, and I am at your service.
I am a trained stormvermin and proud of it. I come from Putrid Lair but I will travel anywhere if it means I become a better fighter.

I am a protector of the Laurelorn forest alongside my group of hooded rangers. I was sent here by the King to try and find out with certainty the nature of the evil which has infected our forest and try to figure out what can be done for us to return.
The world is my oyster {playername} and I don't have time to call a place my home.
I am from the Amazonian rainforest and I got lost one day after being chased by giant snakes.
Not much that you do not already know. I travel around alot, I am never in one place for too long and I pay attention to the details in life.
I am a master brewer who brews the legendary Bugman's XXXXXX, the strongest and best tasting ale you will ever put between your lips.
In truth I don't have a home Captain. I go where ever there are enemies of Lustria.
I am nothing but a pisshead captain, don't mind about me.
I come from the small village of Opolensk but the whole world is my home. I travel around discovering wonders and learning about other cultures.
Yes {reg33?madame:sir}. I am a retired pit fighting champion and trainer. Now I serve you and give your men the benefit of my knowledge.

I come from the Mountains of Mourn, far north of the chaos lands. I was defeated by my tyrant in a fight for the leadership but whilst most losers are eaten, I was lucky to escape. I will return when I am ready and knock him off his throne once and for all.
I am Thrud and I like to Kill! Death! Maim! Mutilate! Destroy!.
Home, don't talk to me about home.

It means nothing to me what you do or who you want to rule. I will support you if that is what you want but don't expect me to bend the knee.
Well, {reg33?Madame:Sir} -- I'd support you. I think you'd give the people the kind of enlightened rule which they have long needed.
It would be an honour to once again protect a great ruler, of course I will support you.
Well, {reg33?Madame:Sir}, I think that you would be the kind of {reg33?Queen:King} that good souls such as myself would be proud to follow into battle...
A King you say, Kings pay better, I can support that.
I cannot judge the legal merits of your claim. However you are a strong leader and do not hesitate to free the lands of undesirables, your people would be safe which is a rarity these days.
So long as you know what you are getting yourself in for, that is alright by me.
Sure thing, you could even make me treasurer? I will look after your coin.
You want it, take it. You fight with me so you have a good chance, just remember who helped you get there when it comes out to handing out the riches.
I don't care who is King or Queen of any land so if this is what you want I will indulge you this once.
I would rather you were a foreign ruler than most of the ones we have now. You can have confidence that my influence will gain you significant support.
Yes.
That would be a fine thing, {reg33?my lady:sir}! Many is the tale of the hero who has proven their worthiness to wear a crown through valor.
I am usually suspicious of those who yearn for the highest power but in your case I will make an exception as you will make a very good ruler.
Well, you live by an honourable code, when you can, generally speaking. That's the best qualification for kingship there is, in my book. You show some respect for the rights of others too.
Why not, captain? I'm sure you'd make a fine {reg33?Queen:King} -- and of course I'd hope you remember the little people like myself who fought for you on your scramble to the throne.

I am no diplomat but I will do my best. I will head to Ulthuan to speak to my high elf cousins about you and your qualities which be fit a {King/Queen}. If the high elves accept you then others will generally be willing too.
Fighting for a King sounds like fun, you can count me in. The pirates will listen to me and they will support your claim after of what I have to say.
What little I can do, I will do it.
You have to make your own luck in life and if yours is to take your place among the rulers of this world then good for you.
Yes, Yes, one word from me and the citizens will speak well of your claim. I have celebrity, may as well use it.

It is not what it used to be, being a ruler in this age. Before in the days of peace it was all pomp and luxury. Now it is nothing but war and protecting your borders. If that is the life you want then so be it.
If that is what you want that is what you will get {reg33?Madame:Sir}.
You will have my support and my advice too, you can trust me to help you in all matters of foreign diplomacy.
To serve a {reg33?Queen:King} would be yet another honour I have brought to my family name. Of course I will help you.
So the world has 2 new rulers to get used to, you and me, who would have thought it! Consider me a faithful ally.
You want to be {reg33?Queen:King}, then you are a {reg33?Queen:King}, I wouldn't let anyone try and tell me different.
You took me on when no one else would. Of course I will support your claim to be {reg33?Queen:King}.

¿Por qué no, capitán? Estoy seguro de que seríais {reg33?una buena Reina:un buen Rey} -- y por supuesto, espero que recordéis a la gente como yo, que le dio un bonito giro en vuestra lucha por el trono.

Why not, captain? I'm sure you'd make a fine {reg33?Queen:King} -- and of course I'd hope you remember the little people like myself who did you a pretty turn on your scramble to the throne.
Why not, captain? I'm sure you'd make a fine {reg33?Queen:King} -- and of course I'd hope you remember the little people like myself who did you a pretty turn on your scramble to the throne.
Why not, captain? I'm sure you'd make a fine {reg33?Queen:King} -- and of course I'd hope you remember the little people like myself who did you a pretty turn on your scramble to the throne.
Why not, captain? I'm sure you'd make a fine {reg33?Queen:King} -- and of course I'd hope you remember the little people like myself who did you a pretty turn on your scramble to the throne.
Why not, captain? I'm sure you'd make a fine {reg33?Queen:King} -- and of course I'd hope you remember the little people like myself who did you a pretty turn on your scramble to the throne.

If you must but don't be thinking I will tolerate you sitting around and playing dress up and talking your life away like other Kings do. You asked me to join you on the promise that we will seek battle against the best.

Of course I will {reg33?Madame:Sir}, there are many lands which would benefit from a ruler like you. However if I am to do this then I must insist that you seek peace with the Empire, maybe even an alliance. We are surrounded by enemies and are constantly attacked some villages know nothing but war. I could not forgive myself if I supported the rise of another enemy of the emperor.

By claiming rulership in this world you make yourself  a target for assassination. Many great Kings and leaders will seek to destroy you and I fear that so many will that I will not be able to protect you. Is such a move worth such a risk?

You would make a great ruler by anyone's account and if you wish they best for your people you could make me surgeon General and I can train a whole load of healers to help serve your army and your people.
I will yes but you should secure the protection of your realm before you have claimed it by allowing me to open an assassin guild which will train many shaven to my bidding and thus your bidding.
I will support you so long as you can assure me that any expansion through conquest will be made against the foul races and not the good, noble factions such as the Empire and the dwarves.

Yes, captain, although be careful you do not bite off more than you can chew. Your army is small and your prestige small compared to the established King's of this world. You may find this move for power over before it is begun.
I would -- on one condition. That one day you conquer the whole of Lustria and give me free reign to explore the dungeons and temples as much as I want. That sounds like fun.
I might support you, just don't go getting all high brow and virtuous on me. Too many rulers try and act like their shit don't stink when they have a past which says otherwise.

You want to be a King then be a King but don't be one of those Kings who spend their days with worrying about words and what is called intrigue. You fight for what is yours and what is not, or I will not support you.
You will need to make a vow to me that you will not invest any effort in building a navy, the sea belongs to us and we cannot allow any new naval powers. Swear it and I will support you.
Sí.

Being a {reg33?Queen:King} is more than just leading an army, You need to conduct yourself and the affairs of state with the highest degree of honour and sensibility. I am not sure you are ready for such a responsibility, however many are rising who would make dreadful rulers and they may have the power to get their way. Maybe supporting you is the more prudent action, if you swear an oath you will be a just and honourable {King\Queen}?
I will of course support you although I have one request.

I would. People might say that you don't have royal blood in your veins. But as far as I've seen, royal blood makes you a skinflint. Kings and nobles will take out loans or commission building projects without half a thought to how they're ever going to pay back all those commoners who expect to eat after an honest day's work. If you ask me, an honest tongue makes a {man/woman} a {king/queen}, not a fancy pedigree.
I would be happy to sing your praises if you make me captain of your personal bodyguard? I would excel at such a distinguished position.

I will support you if you support me. If this power which haunts our land is indeed Sylvania then their armies may rise against us in which case we will have to meet them in open battle. If this happens we will need allies, allies as strong as you.......

It is a males dream to rule but I have always wanted my own little island somewhere which I can call my own and rule how I please. If I help you become {King\Queen} I hope one day you might grant me my wish.
.Of course but if I could be so bold I would like to ask whether you could give me away at my wedding to Florin? Whenever that is of course, I am sure it won't be too long.

Of course I can although maybe you can help me. I have paid back some debts to some less than friendly characters yet they are still trying to extort money from me under any pretext they can think of. I wish I never met them and I need them out of my life for the sake of my own safety and the sake of my bank balance. They are not the kind to listen to anyone but they may listen to a {King\Queen}, will you have a word with them.

Support from the nobility will put your ship to sea but it is support from the common folk which keeps it afloat. If you want people to fight for you, work hard for you and speak well of you then their lives must be made the richer by being one of your subjects. If you tell them you will build infrastructure such as schools and roads and if you lower tax on beer so they can enjoy more of their favourite brew then I know many will be desperate to be under your rule, What do you say?
I can use my influence to gather support for your claim but you must swear never to invade my homeland. Support our sovereignty and I will support you.
Aye Captain I will fall in and out of every tavern praising your name if wish. If you give me the money I will go do just that.

So many want power but so little are willing to use it in a way which benefits their people and even less are willing to give the welfare of other nations any consideration. The world needs new international leadership, someone who can try and make all nations strive for a shared purpose.
Where there is new power there is always war. Many factions will strike out against you if you declare yourself {King/Queen} of anything larger than a small hut.
You wish to bargain for my support? Then I say I will do this if you support me. When I am ready to leave and take back my kingdom you will accompany me and help me win it back. You agree?.
I want you to be {reg33?Queen:King} as that will mean more fights and more sieges. Enemies will rush to our gates which I like.

I always thought I would follow no one but the emperor but there is no way he will allow me back into his confidence. If I have to follow someone else let it be you, but you must vow to be a loyal King.

I will certainly consider it.

Unless they attack me I can assure you no such action will be taken.
It is my desire, how would you suggest I get the support I need?
Sounds like fun to me too.
You should know me better than that.
I have no plans to be peaceful Beorg
I swear it.
Are you sure I can trust you to do this?
I swear it.
Please go on...
Well-spoken, my good man
I will add your name to the list of candidates, I can make no assurances.
When the time comes I will fight beside your armies.
I am always generous to those who serve me well.
I would be honoured.
Alright Florin, Just this once.
What you say is wise, and a small price to pay.
I swear it.
You have enough money yourself, just make sure you spread the word.
What purpose is that?
Go on...
You can count on me Uggluk.
Sounds like a dream come true.
What do you mean?

Believe me I am not the only intolerable person in this conversation.
The Empire is no stranger to offensive wars or claiming land, I can make no such promise.
I can take care of myself maybe I had better ask someone more enthusiastic to speak in my name.
I need you here in my army at all times Oggy.
I can't be seen using skaven assassins as my personal tools of politics and influence. There would be uproar.
No current King rules with such restrictions, look around you, every King takes whatever they can, I will not be an exception.
You underestimate me Braganza, Do not judge the politics of Tilea as the politics of all the Old World.
One doesn't simply conquer the whole of Lustria, It has to be one of the hardest places to take in the Old World, be reasonable..
I will rule as I please.
I am no tyrant Beorg.
A navy has too much strategic value to just dismiss for such small a favour.
On second thoughts what good will you do!
Oaths should be sworn to me, not the other way around.
Another time maybe, for now we march.
{reg33?Queen:King} of the Clerks, maybe, Enough of such talk
If a day comes when I wish to forfeit my life I will be sure to make you captain of the guard.
My armies would be stretched too thinly Scarloc, there are many wars I must fight as well. Maybe the high elves will help you.
A whole island! You don't beat about the bush do you.
You are not my daughter so it would not be proper. Besides have you spoken to Florin about this.
Sort out your own mess.
A cut on beer tax, I wonder who would benefit from that! Nice try Bugman.

To openly favour the lizardmen could harm my chances to form good relations with other more influential factions. In order to protect my interests I must look to secure their friendships first and foremost so I will not swear this oath.
How can I expect to be taken seriously with a sozzled Bastich as my herald. Forget the whole thing.

There is no chance of any general accord being reached between all or even some of the leaders currently ruling at the moment. It is a wonder when any sort of treaty is signed between even two countries, let alone a few.
Let them come.
A whole army of ogres! That may be a bit too much for my troops.
Now you put it like that I better hold off.
You have things the wrong way around Albertus.

I am no diplomat but I do know that a warrior king would be welcomed by many of the powerful families of these lands even if they would never admit it in public. Some of their lesser family members still drink in common taverns so I will gather some support for your claim through them.
If you allow me to leave straight away I could be back within 2 weeks with news of significant support for your cause. I  still have the ear of many noble families back home.

The people of Araby will never accept a {reg33?Queen:King} who does not believe in our religion. However they don't need to accept you, Just tolerating you will put you ahead of most other rulers out there. I know the writers of Araby's most prestigious papers. I will and get them to release some favourable articles about you.
Then I will go and do my best to gain support for your claim. Not many people ever listen to me so I cannot promise success but if you command it then it is what I will do.
While you are away at war you need eyes and ears closer to home to make sure you are not being targeted by malice or treachery. We can be the silent arm of your righteous judgment.
Very well. I will leave right away.

I will leave for a few weeks and I will gather news from my peers as to who is weak at the moment and will plant seeds of a new king rising who could be a potential ally to them. They will recognise you, whether you make an alliance or not is up to you.

Good! Then give me a few weeks and I'll go back to the Moot, letting it be known that you're a {reg33?ruler:king} who respects the Halfings and their way of life. We are a wholly good peoples despite what some like to say.

I can't offer you any help in the lands of Empire and Bretonnia but I have good relations with many prominent families in other factions of the Old World. So long as I persuade them you are no threat to their interests they will speak well of your claim.
Good, then I will leave and will do whatever I can and whatever I please to make sure your claim has support.
Good, You make your kingdom by land, I recommend taking the mountain territories and then expanding north. I will see what I can do to gain you support for your claim.
Sí.
Then give me leave for a few weeks, I am loyal to my King so I can only recommend you in certain terms but that will be enough for the nobility to approve, at least initially.

I request that you lay aside any plans you have for world domination and be content with a reasonable size kingdom. Many rulers don't think of the cost in lives of troops and companions when they take on these wars of supremacy. So many generations have been lost and the prize, if ever achieved which is rare indeed, is never worth the sacrifice. Let your people know peace.

I'm glad you think so. Here's what I suggest. I know men in the guilds here, and in the town halls, who've been shafted and shaken down until they can take no more. Here's what I'll tell them -- you're honest. You respect the rights of all classes. You'll pay your debts. You won't beggar your subjects.
Excellent, that is good enough for me. I know you will make the right choice.
Thank you {playername}, with this new alliance, this new strength, we can consider ourselves a step closer to salvation.
Then I will redouble my efforts on the battlefield and use every gift I possess to try and establish you as a legitimate ruler.
Thank you so much, What a wonderful day it will be. I am off to do my duty.
A great weight has been lifted from my shoulders, thank you. I will now find my bards outfit and go sing about you in Leoncour's halls.
Then I will write an article of support for your claim and stating your new policies and have it put up in all my taverns. That way the word will spread in most civilized countries.
Very well then, I will help you. If you ever become a {reg33?Queen:King} then you could go even further and form an alliance with us, our armies are the toughest in the world.
Excellent, I will be off then although I will miss out those skaven taverns. The beer always tastes strange there.

The purpose of mutual co operation and mutual peace between all nations. We need an organisation which can speak for all and allow all agreements and disagreements to be discussed and negotiated openly between nations. This will prevent war and encourage understanding, you could head this organisation with my help.

There is no ruler in this world who does not think that he has too many enemies and the last thing they need is another one popping up. They will try and crush you but with the right training and leadership your army can hold them off and prepare a counter attack which will make everyone fear you and think twice about attacking you again. Speak to me when I return and I will tell you how.
Then the pact is sealed and we are now on our paths to glory and stature together.
Just put me on the top of a siege ladder with hundreds of fodder running up at me and you will see my dream come true.

I mean don't forget those who have supported you and fought for you on your journey to power. Don't betray those who deserve your respect like the Emperor and my peers have done me. We are all loyal to you {playername}, you will see your faith well invested.

With your permission I shall go spread word of your right to be {reg33?Queen:King}.
With your permission I shall go spread word of your right to be {reg33?Queen:King}.
With your permission I shall go spread word of your right to be {reg33?Queen:King}.
With your permission I shall go spread word of your right to be {reg33?Queen:King}.
With your permission I shall go spread word of your right to be {reg33?Queen:King}.

Are you a clown {playername}? I know you want to be {reg33?Queen:King} but maybe you should consider the jesters hat instead of a crown. First you send off skeezle in your own name and now you are considering him to be your head bodyguard. You are a joke and so it he.

If you want to be taken seriously then sending a Skaven to champion your claim is the worst thing you could do. I really don't understand your decision, Skaven are scum, is that how you want to be seen?
Beorg's policy of destroy and conquer is a great evil you should not associate yourself with. You are no tyrant, do not be swayed by the ways of chaos.

Captain, every ruler in the land will see you sending Beorg out as emissary as a threat to their land. The only reason you send a cold blooded killer to speak for you is if you want to send a warning, there is nothing diplomatic about it. I fear a grave response.

Do not ally yourself with the underdogs as soon as you become {reg33?Queen:King}. The Wood Elves will soon be a thing of the past, skaven on the other hand will grow from strength to strength. There is a better alliance for you.

Are you out of your mind appeasing the Dark Elves over their naval plans. Do you have any idea what the fate of the world would be if they controlled the seas? It will be a perfect set up for their domination of all the land. You must see sense.
What are you trying to achieve by sending Gotrek out as a political envoy? If you need a champion in a duel then he is your warrior but in the subtle game if diplomacy he is a naive choice.

{reg33?Queen:King} I would call Eleanor back if I were you. She is a con artist and is well known for it. If she goes around calling herself your trusted companion everyone will think you are a cheat too.

If you want to make an impression upon those who hold power then don't send Felix as your envoy. He bores me to tears and I can tell you that I am not the only one who he has that effect on. If you want to be King you need to make an impression, and sending Mr all talk and no fight is not the right one to make.
You want people to think you a weak {reg33?Queen:King}? Then why send the weak Sir Aristide. Soft rulers perish in this land, I should know, I have slain enough of them.

A ruler who cares for all classes always takes their eyes off the ball. Soft policies like the one Abdul is suggesting will lead to your downfall, concentrate on the strong classes of your society, the ones which will further your power and the power of your realm. The others can look after themselves.
Boo Abdul.

I have a good mind to leave your service right now. To send Beorg for such an important role, when honourable gentleman such as myself are associated with you and are tarnished by this infamous play. It is infamous!

Captain if you have the skaven running your security and intelligence agencies you will be viewed with suspicion by everyone. Every time there is a murder or a plot unhatched somewhere your country will always get the blame and this will lead to war. Do not indulge Ripnitch in his ambitions.

{reg33?Queen:King} if you want people to legitimise your claim then you need to send out people who are articulate, well spoken and with a knowledge of foreign relations and the customs of this world. Bastich is the polar opposite of this, I fear you have made a great mistake and your reputation will suffer for it.

You know Volands is the bastard son of the Emperor right? By sending him out as your diplomat you will alarm all those in the Emperors circle who know. They will think you plan to replace Karl Franz and they will seek to destroy you. The Empire is too big an enemy to make for a new kingdom.

I see Bugman has wormed his way in to your inner circle. Acting as your diplomat, no doubt earning your trust so he can get ahead with his businesses in your new kingdom. It is up to you if you want to trust him but if you want important diplomatic work done it is best he is nowhere near it, or any dwarf for that matter.

You can make Florin feel like a big man without having him do such an important job for you. He will mess this up as he always does you can be sure of it and you will be the one to suffer, He just wants an ego boost that comes with being someone important, he does not care about your claom.

I am so glad you have sent Bastich away but I am sorry you sent him on such an important mission. I really want you to become {King\Queen} but he will make you a laughing stock. Find out where he went and steer clear of there in future.

Dark Elves are treacherous {playername}, everyone knows this. You send out Eketi to speak well of you but you don't know what he will say when he gets there. He could well spread discontent to increase your enemies and start a war once your kingdom is formed. This could act as a distraction for the Dark Elves to make their move.

Skeezle is a lowlife {playername}, having him as your personal bodyguard would be like me choosing Jalil or Abdul Khaliq as my master brewers, what the hell would they know about making ale! If you need a personal bodyguard just choose Thrud or Gotrek if you can promise him the right amount of danger.

The less land the pirates have the better. An island will just be used as a base for more of their illegal raiding and plundering of the south coast. Even with you as her {King\Queen Eleanor should not be trusted.

Amazons are heathens {reg33?Queen:King} and while she is a pretty heathen she is a heathen never the less and having her supporting your claim will only raise suspicion about your own beliefs. Best call her back.

You should have told Bastich to stay sober when you agreed to have him go out garnering support for your claim. Heaven knows what he will say when he is out there, he is notorious for saying the wrong thing after a few hours on the rum.

A mild manner, orc healer is a bit of a novelty and if you don't mind me saying using him as a diplomat sends out the wrong message if you want to be seen as a real player among the ruling families in this world. You should have sent someone with authority and a hint of menace like Volands or Gotrek.

Bug is dumb and you are dumb for thinking he can help gain you any support for your claim. What is he going to say that makes any sense to people, nothing! What good is that? His place is on the battlefield and that is it.

Sir Aristide is all words and no action. For all his chivalry I have killed more enemies and saved more lives than he could dream of. You should send real heroes out to champion your claim and not posers like him.

Volands is a maverick and a man lacking in manners. He has a warrant for his death in 2 countries and he is wanted for arrest in 3 others. Sending him out to gain you support for your claim will only weaken it. The amount of noble families he knows who will listen to him are very few.

There are not many people I want to see again but I do have a few contacts in {s17}, they would find it strange me asking as they know I don't care for gossip. They would not deny me though and if there is anything to be  found out about {s18} I will stay a for a few extra days of drinking as well.
{reg33?My lady:Sir}, if you're interested in events in {s18}, I can still make contact with my old university {s17}. They're usually well-informed about political events.

The publishing houses in Araby will know anything that could be known about {s18}, they make it there business to know as much as they can about anything. I will speak to my contact in  {s17} right away.

I have healed a few warriors in my time who were grateful for my work, including some who fought in {s17}, they will most likely know about  {s18}. They say they owe me a debt, let's see if they are willing to repay it.

If you like, {playername}, I can take a few days to visit my Eshin kin. They work in an underground network in {s17}, and hear the news from all across the {s18}. They may have some gossip about the feuds and rivaries of the great lords, if that is of interest to you.

I have contacts everywhere, You need to in my line of work. I will seek information from the high council about {s18}, I will also get news of any signs of impending invasions. I will set off for {s18} immediately.
I am familiar with {s17}, if there is anything pertinent to be learnt about {s18} then I will find out and return to you as soon as I can.

If you have any interest in the events in the {s18}, a former priest-companion of mine retired and now keeps a farm near {s17}. He keeps in contact with a number of other old diplomats. I could visit him for a few days, and learn more about what is going on there.

My Venators travel everywhere, we have men in nearly every tavern in the old world and as a consequence have made many friends over the years. If you want to know about {s18} then I will be sure to find out all there is to know in {s18} from one source or another.
I will go to {s17} and find out all that needs to be known about {s18}, I will leave no one alive.
Let me go and speak to my superiors in {s17}. They will know detailed information about {s18}, they may also be able to tell me when I will get my command back.
Me sneak to {s17}. I hear talk of {s18}, me tell you.
Word spreads fast in certain circles, especially in Bretonnia and if one desires news of {s18} then they should look no further then the prophetess sisterhood which is found in {s17}.

Captain... I sell horses to the garrison of {s17}. One of their number has lately been in touch with me, and suggests that if I were to visit him, he could pass me information on events within the {s18}. I am willing to do this, if you can spare me.

Captain. As you may know, I have for some time harboured a wish to go to {s17}, and study the masonry -- one of the finest examples of the older styles. As it happens, one of my colleagues is currently engaged there doing repair work on the curtain wall. While his sense of professional obligation I think would prevent him, rightfully, from disclosing to me any weaknesses in its defenses, I suspect that he would not be averse to offering up his opinion on the general state of the {s18}, if that is of interest to you.

If there is one thing the Skaven can do well it is to spy on others and to find ways into places they should not. I will go and speak to the Eshin elders in {s17}. They will know about the goings-on in the {s18}.

Information of this kind is best sought in Tilea. Mercenary captains and merchant Princes like to know everything as knowledge is often a bargaining tool in that part of the world. I will travel there and see what I can find out about {s18}.

The hidden pirate coves in and around the region of {s17} are inhabited by the whisperers who trade in knowledge which they get from their teams of spies and moles all over the world. I will speak to them about {s18} and I know you will not be left disappointed.
I will try and find out about {s18}, I don't really know how. Maybe I can go and speak to the sisterhood in {s17}, they might be able to find me.
Bretonnians are not that knowledgeable on foreign affairs, I would be better off going to speak to my old guild. I will head for {s17} and see what they know about {s18}.

There is nowhere better for over hearing important information than a Bugman's tavern. Alcohol can make even the most careful of tongues slip up, especially when my strongest brews are involved. I will head to my tavern in {s17} and prick my ears for any information about {s18}.

We like to keep ourselves to ourselves so military intelligence is not our strong point but we opened a branch before the chaos invasion in case we have the need again. I will go and see them in {s17} and ask what they know about {s18} although I cannot say for sure I will find out anything of worth.

Most pirates I know who would have that kind of information are dead. I know someone at {s17} who knows a lot about {s18} but he is 90 so I cannot vouch for his wits or his memory. I will go see him anyway.

I know someone in {s17} who can help us although it will take me a fair few days to get there and back. It will be worth the trip though as they are sure to give me all they have on {s18} which should be everything.
That kind of information will not come cheap but at least I know where to find it. There is a man in {s17} who can help us, he will give us all we need to know about {s18}.

I will ask around, maybe in {s17} they will know something. I can't say I have ever needed this kind of information before but if you want updates on {s18} then there is the only place I can think to go.
I will go to {s17} and break as many skulls as I have to until they tell me everything about {s18}. I won't be long.

{s18} you say, that is easy enough. Well it is easy to find someone who knows, he is a good friend but whether he will tell me now is another thing altogether. I will head to {s17} and see if I have any good will remaining towards me.

I don't know what use you think I would have for a fief such as {s17}. Nevertheless you are trying to be generous so I will accept your offer and figure out what to do with it later.

My family will be very proud to see me as the Lord of {s17}. I have not always been the son they wanted and I know I have displeased in the past but this will surely make them see what I am worth. Thank you so much.
{reg33?My Lady:Sir}, it is most generous of you to offer me {s17}. I would be pleased to hold it, and dedicate myself to the spiritual and physical uplift of its inhabitants.
It is a great surprise that you would grant me {s17} as a fief. I am not respected by most yet you would do me this great honour. Thank you.
I would be most pleased to hold {s17}. I will send word to my brothers that I have a safe and protected place to bury victims and items that are best never found, for a price of course.

{playername} I have little time to rule but know some trusted administrators who can keep things running in my stead. You do me more than just honour by giving me this fief, I now have a base for my campaigns and a place to host council meetings. I am in your debt.

I am reluctant to accept {s17} as it makes me more of a target as I was before. However I will not be in this position forever and when I retire I will need a place of my own so I will accept your generous offer.

Thank you {reg33?Madame:Sir}, this is a most unexpected honour. It is usually impossible for Halflings to gain foreign land anywhere other than the Empire. This will raise my status back at the moot, it will justify everything I have ever done.
This is why I knew you would be a good employer. You remember those who have contributed most to your success. I accept this honour and will hold a 3 day drinking festival in your honour.

You amuse me with this offer. I usually take what I want rather than be given but you are not of pure mind so it is to be expected. I am fulfilled in your army so I will accept your offer rather than undermine you in front of your troops.

You are very smart {playername}, giving land to the commander of the Naggaroth fleet will completely throw your enemies. They won't know what to think and will be second guessing your intentions as well as your political strength. This is always an advantage.
Skreeeeech you are good to me. I would give you some madcap to say thank you but I have taken it all, hahahahaha.

I was born to hold land and to watch over communities of gentle folk but I did not think I would hold land in any other country other than Bretonnia. You do me great honour by deeming me worthy of this position. I accept most graciously.

You do me a great honor, captain. In Ulthuan, a youngest son such as myself has few opportunities to earn a fief of his own. But in other kingdoms there is still the chance for a warrior to win with with his spear, the privilege which is so hard to earn under Finubar. I shall hold {s17} as your vassal, and raise an army to fight for your glory and for your kingdom.

Well, {reg33?my lady:sir}, that's a gracious act, and marks you as the kind of monarch who can save this sorry land from the incompetence of the current batch. I suspect a lot of the noble lords around here will think that a commoner like me isn't fit to hold a fief. Well, when they see what I do with it, and what revenues I can bring in, they'll change their tune!

Oh, that's most generous of you, {reg33?my lady:sire}. I've been in and out of many a great hall or manor -- not always with the owner's permission, I should add -- but I never thought I'd own one myself.

To accept a new home when my people have none seems like a crass, dishonourable thing to do but we need a sanctuary for our injured, one nearer civilization as our new location does not provide for us in the same way Laurelorn does.
You are a friend indeed {playername} and a mighty fine leader if you don't mind me saying so. I am now the lady of my own domain, this calls for a new hat.

You are too generous {reg33?Madame:Sir}, now I have a family home where I can bring up some children with Florin. I wish he would stay with me and stops going off on his adventures. He always says soon but there is always a reason for him to go.
I am not normally one who would wish to be anyone's vassal but for a fief of this quality I don't see how I can say no. Show me to my new land.

You know I have my own fief back home but I have left my friend in control until I am ready to return. It is a great responsibility to have so many people under your protection and I failed my duty when the goblins took so many of their lives. Maybe if I treat the people of {s17} well then I can regain my honour and think about going home.

We have been seeking for a place on foreign soil to set up a base for our intelligence agency and {s17} is perfect for this. I am grateful for this and the honour you have shown me by granting me this title.
I was always wondering where I would stay when I retire but now you have provided me with the perfect spot. You have my thanks Captain, lets have a drink to celebrate.

I am honoured and humbled by your generosity and you can be sure I will treat my subjects with the utmost care and respect. Just give me one year and you will see how things will flourish around here.

The fief of {s17} is a quality piece of land and one I will use it to maximum effect. It will train fine soldiers and hopefully grow enough food for the entire army. In a world of war we must be prepared.
Thank you {playername} I owe you one. I will take it's ownership to my new kingdom when I claim my throne but I am sure you knew that anyway.
Thrud is confused by the gift but will take it. Anyway where is the next battle?

Oh {playername} you are a loyal friend and leader. I did not think I would ever own my own land again but you have changed my destiny. You can count on me to make this a stronghold of defence for your realm.
Sería para mí un honor serviros gobernando {s17} para vos.

It would be my honor to serve you by governing {s17} for you.
